question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden make a public declaration before July 15, 2024 stating that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for President?

This resolves the same way as the original question on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be marked as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and official statement indicating that he will not pursue or accept his party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election.

For a Yes resolution, the announcement must be straightforward and definitive, leaving no doubt that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for the presidency in the upcoming 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, the question will be resolved as No.

Further details and background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question is resolved, its outcome will automatically apply to this market. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is clear and certain. Feel free to contact @jskf for early resolution requests or to report any issues.

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

not_P.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is <=46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: Is there a chance that Kamala's likelihood of victory will rise in the upcoming week based on Nate Silver's model?
para_P.body:
This will be deemed YES if the probability of Harris in the Electoral College according to Nate Silver's model exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. It will be considered NO if it does not.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, AND will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this resolves as No.

(2) Will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? This resolves as Yes if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. Resolves No otherwise.

This question will resolve as Yes if both (1) and (2) resolve as Yes.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic nomination for President, OR will Kamala Harris's odds of winning not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
not_P.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. If such a statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this resolves as No.

(2) Will Kamala Harris's odds of winning not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? This resolves as Yes if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is <=46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. Resolves No otherwise.

This question will resolve as Yes if either (1) or (2) resolves as Yes.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will declare by July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President, AND will the chances of Kamala Harris winning rise in the upcoming week based on Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body:
(1) Is it possible that Joe Biden will declare by July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not seek or accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be clear and definitive, leaving no doubt that Biden would accept the nomination in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this will be considered No.

(2) Is it possible that Kamala Harris's chances of winning will improve over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? This will be considered Yes if the probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. Otherwise, it will resolve as No.

This question will resolve as Yes if both (1) and (2) resolve as Yes.

question.title: Will either Joe Biden announce he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President before July 15, 2024, or Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body: (a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination for a Yes resolution. (b) Will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Will neither Joe Biden announce he will accept the Democratic nomination for President before July 15, 2024, nor will Kamala Harris's odds of winning decrease over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
not_P.body: (a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must leave no room for the possibility that Biden would decline the nomination for a Yes resolution. (b) Will Kamala Harris's odds of winning decrease over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is ≤46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that Joe Biden will declare he won't seek the Democratic nomination for President prior to July 15, 2024, or that Kamala Harris's likelihood of winning will rise in the upcoming week as per Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body: (a) Is it possible that Joe Biden will make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This is considered a Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, either Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, official statement indicating he will not pursue or accept the nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must unequivocally rule out any chance of Biden accepting the nomination for a Yes outcome. (b) Will there be an increase in Kamala Harris's chances of winning in the next week according to Nate Silver's model? This resolves as YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's analysis exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. It resolves to NO in all other cases.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not die before Saturday?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Joe Biden to pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if there is a formal declaration of Joe Biden's death prior to the market closing on Friday, July 26th. 

If not, it will be a NO.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

not_P.title: Will Biden not remain President through end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he remains President through that time.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden still be in office as President by the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if Biden is still the President of the United States at the conclusion of July 2024 (Eastern Time); it will be a NO if he steps down, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not result in a YES outcome. (An Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday and remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, and (b) Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). It resolves NO if either condition is not met. Note that a temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect the resolution of condition (b).

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not die before Saturday or not remain President through end of July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves YES if either of the following conditions is not met: (a) There is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, or (b) Joe Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). It resolves NO if both conditions are met. Note that a temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect the resolution of condition (b).

para_P.title: Is it possible for Joe Biden to pass away prior to Saturday and still hold the position of President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if both of the following stipulations are satisfied: (a) An official declaration of Joe Biden's passing occurs before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, and (b) Joe Biden continues to serve as the US President until the end of July 2024 (ET). It will be deemed negative if either stipulation is not fulfilled. Please note that a temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment does not influence the determination of stipulation (b).

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden dies before Saturday, July 26th, 2024, or (b) Biden does not remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

(b) Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This includes if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden dies before Saturday, July 26th, 2024, nor (b) Biden remains President through the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

(b) Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This includes if he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either of the following happens: (a) Joe Biden passes away prior to Saturday, July 26th, 2024, or (b) Biden is no longer serving as President by the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is an official confirmation of Joe Biden's passing before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

(b) Resolves YES if Biden does not continue as President of the United States until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET). This includes scenarios where he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date. A temporary handover of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., designating his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution, as the Acting President is distinct from the President according to the Constitution.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The lack of removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention is verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will conclude with a "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen *after* the stated date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office based on the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and later reinstated, so that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports, and not through speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements. The question resolves as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: This does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after the date. If Trump is removed or blocked and then reinstated such that on July 15th he is not removed or blocked, the question resolves negatively.

(b) This question will resolve as "Yes" if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as "No". The question solely determines by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, nor (b) Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

(a) This question will resolve as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports, and not through speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements. The question resolves as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024. Note: This does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after the date. If Trump is removed or blocked and then reinstated such that on July 15th he is not removed or blocked, the question resolves positively.

(b) This question will resolve as "Yes" if Donald Trump is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as "Yes". The question solely determines by who is not selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) Donald Trump is disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

(a) This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either of the following will happen: (a) Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, or (b) Donald Trump will secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if at least one of the following scenarios occurs:

(a) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or any subsequent reversals that may take place after the specified date. It strictly addresses whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds by July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then later reinstated, such that by July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

The outcome is determined solely by the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 U.S. election.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

not_P.title: Kamala not president by Friday?
not_P.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is not formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

para_P.title: Will Kamala Harris assume the presidency by Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. If this does not occur, the market will end with a "No".

The main source for resolution will be official announcements from the US government, but a consensus of reliable news sources will also be considered.

Resolver

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will Biden not drop out before July 20?
not_P.body: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: In the event that Biden withdraws or is unable to proceed with the campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President by July 26, 2024? (b) Joe Biden drops out of the race before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this component will be official information from the US government, with a consensus of credible reporting as a secondary source.

(b) Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. The resolution source for this component will be whether Biden drops out or is unable to continue the race by the specified date and time.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President by July 26, 2024? (b) Joe Biden drops out of the race before July 20, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Kamala Harris is not formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this component will be official information from the US government, with a consensus of credible reporting as a secondary source.

(b) Joe Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race after July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. The resolution source for this component will be whether Biden does not drop out or is able to continue the race past the specified date and time.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of these events to happen: (a) Kamala Harris is appointed as President or Acting President by July 26, 2024? (b) Joe Biden exits the race prior to July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) At any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States. The primary source for determining this will be official announcements from the US government, with a consensus of reliable media reports serving as a secondary source.

(b) Joe Biden withdraws from or is otherwise unable to participate in the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. The determining factor for this component will be whether Biden has withdrawn or is unable to continue the race by the specified deadline.

question.title: Will either Kamala Harris become President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, or will Biden drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if either of the following occurs: (a) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting; (b) Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. If neither event occurs, this question will resolve to "No."

not_P.title: Will neither Kamala Harris become President nor Acting President by July 26, 2024, nor will Biden drop out before July 20, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if neither of the following occurs: (a) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting; (b) Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. If either event occurs, this question will resolve to "No."

para_P.title: Is it possible for Kamala Harris to assume the role of President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, or for Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if one of the following happens: (a) Vice President Kamala Harris is officially appointed as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, according to official US government announcements or a consensus of reliable news sources; (b) Joe Biden withdraws from the race or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. If neither scenario takes place, the answer will be "No."

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, and will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

(b) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, or will someone other than Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if at least one of the following conditions is met:

(a) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The lack of removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

(b) Someone other than Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot for any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, and will Ted Cruz emerge as the Republican candidate for the 2024 United States Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

(a) By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The disqualification or prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. This question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may arise after the specified date. It strictly concerns whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or prevented from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

(b) Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 United States Presidential Election. This is determined by the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 United States election.

question.title: Will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

not_P.title: Will the USA win no more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins no more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

para_P.title: Will the USA secure a greater number of Gold medals compared to Silver at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the United States Olympic Team achieves a higher count of Gold medals than Silver medals during the Paris 2024 Olympics.

question.title: Will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

not_P.title: Will USA not top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are not the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if no team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

para_P.title: Will the United States lead the Medal Standings at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if the United States Olympic Team is the sole team ranked highest at the Paris 2024 Olympics. It will be considered unclear if the Paris Olympics do not occur before 2027. It will be marked as negative if any other team achieves a ranking that is equal to or surpasses that of the US team.

The medal standings are determined by tallying all the medals acquired by each participating nation and arranging them according to:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In the case of a tie in Golds) Total Silver Medals
3. (In the case of a tie in Silvers) Total Bronze Medals.

question.title: Will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals and top the Olympic Medal Table at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. (b) The United States Olympic Team is the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The ranking is determined by the number of Gold Medals won, followed by Silver Medals, and then Bronze Medals in case of ties. The question will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027.

not_P.title: Will the USA win equal or fewer Gold than Silver medals or not top the Olympic Medal Table at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves Yes if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) The United States Olympic Team wins equal or fewer Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. (b) The United States Olympic Team is not the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The ranking is determined by the number of Gold Medals won, followed by Silver Medals, and then Bronze Medals in case of ties. The question will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027.

para_P.title: Will the USA secure a greater number of Gold medals compared to Silver and lead the Olympic Medal Table at the Paris 2024 Games?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) The United States Olympic Team achieves a higher count of Gold medals than Silver medals during the Paris 2024 Games. (b) The United States Olympic Team is the sole top-ranked team at the 2024 Paris Games. The ranking is based on the total Gold Medals earned, followed by Silver Medals, and then Bronze Medals in the event of ties. The question will remain unresolved if the Paris Games are not held prior to 2027.

question.title: Will either of the following occur at the Paris 2024 Olympics: (a) The USA wins more Gold than Silver medals (b) The USA tops the Olympic Medal Table?
question.body:
(a) This resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

(b) This resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team is the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It resolves ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It resolves No if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team. The medal table is calculated by:
1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur at the Paris 2024 Olympics: (a) The USA wins more Gold than Silver medals (b) The USA does not top the Olympic Medal Table?
not_P.body:
(a) This resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team does not win more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

(b) This resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team is not the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It resolves ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It resolves No if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team. The medal table is calculated by:
1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the USA to achieve one of the following at the Paris 2024 Olympics: (a) Securing a greater number of Gold medals than Silver medals (b) Ranking first in the Olympic Medal Table?
para_P.body:
(a) This is considered Yes if the United States Olympic Team achieves a higher count of Gold medals compared to Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

(b) This is deemed Yes if the United States Olympic Team stands as the sole highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It is considered ambiguous if the Paris Olympics do not occur before 2027. It is regarded as No if any other team matches or exceeds the ranking of the US team. The medal table is determined by:
1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie) Total Silver Medals
3. (In case of another tie) Total Bronze Medals.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the proposal to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

A number of House Democrats are putting together a strategy to oppose their party’s initiative to expedite President Joe Biden’s nomination, which they believe suppresses the critical ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their members are still quite concerned about the prospects of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone thinks it’s a smart approach to stifle debate and, I suppose, through sheer force, achieve unity, but that’s not how it works,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming the existence of the letter.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination initiative is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who affiliate with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will INC form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the INC has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections. All other parties will resolve as **No**.

This question will resolve for the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022 (currently expected for May 2024).

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will at least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

not_P.title: Will fewer than 5 countries win their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if fewer than 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 5 nations secure their inaugural Olympic medal during the 2024 Games?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if 5 or more nations achieve their first Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, as per [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

not_P.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will fewer than 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if fewer than 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

para_P.title: During the 2024 Olympic Games, will five or more nations secure their first gold medal?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if five or more nations achieve their inaugural Olympic gold medal at the Paris Games, based on [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Olympics: (a) At least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal and (b) At least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met at the Paris Olympics: (1) 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic medal and (2) 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

not_P.title: Will not both of the following occur at the 2024 Olympics: (a) At least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal or (b) At least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is not met at the Paris Olympics: (1) 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic medal or (2) 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 5 nations achieve their initial Olympic medal and at least 5 nations secure their first gold medal at the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of these criteria are fulfilled at the Paris Olympics: (1) 5 or more nations earn their first Olympic medal and (2) 5 or more nations earn their first Olympic gold medal, based on [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Will at least 5 countries win either their first Olympic medal or their debut gold medal at the 2024 Games?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if at least 5 countries win either their first-ever Olympic medal or their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

not_P.title: Will less than 5 countries win neither their first Olympic medal nor their debut gold medal at the 2024 Games?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if less than 5 countries win neither their first-ever Olympic medal nor their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

para_P.title: Will at least 5 nations secure either their inaugural Olympic medal or their first gold medal at the 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if a minimum of 5 nations achieve either their first-ever Olympic medal or their first-ever Olympic gold medal during the Paris Olympics, as per [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it is evident that there are 10 or more Democratic Senators, this market will resolve to yes. If not, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is another presidential debate for the Democratic party expected?
para_P.body: Resolves YES if a debate occurs among prospective Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO in all other cases.

question.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20 AND will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body:
(1) Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20? Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

(2) Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate? Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

This combined question resolves to YES only if both (1) and (2) resolve to YES.

(2) Will there be no another Democratic party presidential debate? Resolves YES if there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

This combined question resolves to YES only if either (1) or (2) resolves to YES.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT not be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
not_P.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If available in certain EU countries, or available to (for example) minors, this will still resolve negatively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves negatively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be widely accessible in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is widely accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and with **NO** if it is not.

"Widely accessible" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (though payment may be required). If it is not available in specific EU nations (as was observed in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not accessible to certain groups (like minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome, provided that more than 50% of the population can access it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. It will still be considered a positive outcome even if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to input queries into systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will a group of fewer than 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators not pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are met before July 20th, this market resolves YES.

para_P.title: Will at least five identified Democratic House Representatives or Senators apply pressure on Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have expressed to local news sources that they believe Biden's chances for a November victory are slim.

Behind closed doors, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several versions of letters being shared among House Democrats, with at least one draft urging Biden to cease his campaign, as reported by five individuals familiar with the situation.

This market will conclude with a YES if a coalition of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to request that Joe Biden contemplate ending his 2024 re-election bid before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could take the form of signing a letter as mentioned above, or it might occur through a collective discussion with Biden in person, where they together ask him to withdraw.

It is essential that all five individuals are part of the same group communication. Five individuals individually telling journalists they believe Biden should withdraw does not qualify for a YES outcome.

Any reports of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden requesting him to step down will not meet the market's requirements unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market closes. In cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond reasonable doubt, the market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not fulfilled by July 20th, the market will resolve as NO.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th AND will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
This question resolves to YES if both of the following conditions are met:

1. A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message, and their names must be made public before the end date.

2. Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

If both of these criteria are met within their respective time frames, this question resolves YES. If either or both are not met, it resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will no group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th OR will Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question resolves to YES if either of the following conditions is met:

1. No group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators works together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This means that either fewer than five individuals are involved, or they do not publicly ask Biden to drop out.

2. Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will seek or will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must leave room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

If either or both of these criteria are met within their respective time frames, this question resolves YES. If both are not met, it resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a coalition of at least five identified Democratic House Representatives or Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20th AND will Joe Biden publicly declare by July 15, 2024 that he will not pursue the Democratic presidential nomination?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as YES if both of the following conditions are satisfied:

1. A coalition of no fewer than five specified Democratic Party US House Representatives or US Senators collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate ceasing his 2024 re-election bid, or to strongly encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could involve signing a letter or another method such as a collective discussion with Biden in person where they collectively implore him to withdraw. All five individuals must be part of the same group communication, and their identities must be disclosed publicly before the deadline.

2. Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will neither pursue nor accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be unequivocal and final, allowing no possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

If both of these conditions are met within their specified time frames, this question will resolve as YES. If either or both are not fulfilled, it will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) A group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th? (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Will a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time)? This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this resolves NO.

(b) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this resolves as No.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) A group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th nor (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
not_P.body:
(a) Will a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators NOT work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time)? This could mean that they do not collectively ask him to drop out in any form. If these criteria are met before July 20th, this resolves YES.

(b) Will Joe Biden NOT announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as No if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this resolves as Yes.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following happens: (a) At least five identified Democratic House Representatives or Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw before July 20th? (b) Joe Biden declares by July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) Is it possible for a coalition of no fewer than five specified Democratic Party members from the US House of Representatives or US Senate to collaborate in urging Joe Biden to contemplate ending his re-election bid for 2024, or to press him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)? This could involve signing a letter or engaging in another method such as a group discussion with Biden where they collectively request him to withdraw. All five individuals must be part of the same group communication. If five individuals separately inform reporters about their belief that Biden should withdraw, that will not meet the criteria. Additionally, reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden asking him to step aside will not fulfill this market's requirements unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market's closing date. If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, the outcome will be NO.

(b) Is there a chance that Joe Biden will announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the nomination for President from the Democratic Party? This will be marked as Yes if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official declaration stating that he will not pursue nor accept the Democratic nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be clear and definitive. If such a conclusive statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, the outcome will be No.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

not_P.body:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

para_P.body:

To qualify for a No resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as Yes.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following events take place: (a) Russia gains control of Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden publicly declares before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?

The inquiry will be considered **No** if the location is not categorized under any indicators of Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Territorial Gains by Ukraine in the Past 24 Hours

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will be answered No.
