question.title: Will Taylor Swift cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine?
question.body:
Resolves YES if she appears in the movie in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. Will still resolve YES if she is not credited on IMDB, if it is still confirmed by independent sources. 

[image]https://people.com/will-taylor-swift-play-dazzler-in-deadpool-and-wolverine-8651310

not_P.title: Will Taylor Swift not cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine?
not_P.body: Resolves YES if she does not appear in the movie in any role, including if her voice is not used for a character. Will still resolve YES if she is credited on IMDB, if it is still confirmed by independent sources.

para_P.title: Is Taylor Swift going to make a cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine?
para_P.body: This will be resolved as YES if she is featured in the film in any capacity, including if only her voice is utilized for a character. It will also be marked as YES even if she is not listed on IMDB, provided that independent sources confirm her appearance.

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

not_P.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine not have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [not ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
not_P.body:
Analysts are projecting that the opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie will not be huge.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn less than $340 million globally in its opening weekend. This would not mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with less than $160 million, making it not the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie not top these marks? It will probably be far from it...

It will certainly play at fewer theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses less than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) does not report it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is < $284.5M internationally... this weekend

para_P.title: Could the Deadpool & Wolverine film achieve the highest opening weekend for an R-rated film? [surpassing Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
para_P.body:
Experts are forecasting a monumental opening weekend for the "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover film.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The movie, helmed by Shawn Levy and featuring Ryan Reynolds, is anticipated to rake in between $340 million and $360 million globally during its opening weekend. This would set a new record for the largest opening weekend for an R-rated film. In the domestic market, the film is projected to launch with $160 million to $170 million, making it the all-time highest R-rated opening.

"""

[image]The current record for the largest opening weekend for an R-rated film is held by the original Deadpool, which made $284.5M ($152.2M domestically).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will this new release surpass those figures? It seems it might be very close...

It will definitely be shown in more theaters... Deadpool was a remarkable success at its release, and somewhat unexpected.

Since BoxOfficeMojo has a peculiar way of reporting international opening weekends -- providing raw figures but aggregating them oddly -- we will await confirmation from Hollywood Reporter regarding the weekend's opening numbers.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine earns more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) acknowledges it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words, the BoxOfficeMojo figures should be regarded as unofficial until there is validation in the Hollywood press. And the target number we aim for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Taylor Swift will cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine (b) Deadpool & Wolverine will have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
question.body:
Resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Taylor Swift appears in the movie "Deadpool and Wolverine" in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. This will resolve YES even if she is not credited on IMDB, as long as it is confirmed by independent sources.

2. "Deadpool & Wolverine" grosses more than $284.5M globally in its opening weekend according to reports, and the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release. The number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally during this weekend.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Taylor Swift will not cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine nor (b) Deadpool & Wolverine will not have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if neither of the following conditions are met:

1. Taylor Swift does not appear in the movie "Deadpool and Wolverine" in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. This will resolve YES even if she is not credited on IMDB, as long as it is confirmed by independent sources.

2. "Deadpool & Wolverine" does not gross more than $284.5M globally in its opening weekend according to reports, and the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) does not report it as the record for an R-rated movie release. The number we shoot for is <=$284.5M internationally during this weekend.

para_P.title: Are both of these events going to take place: (a) Taylor Swift will make a cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine (b) Deadpool & Wolverine will achieve the highest opening weekend ever for an R-rated film?
para_P.body:
This will be considered TRUE if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

1. Taylor Swift participates in the film "Deadpool and Wolverine" in any capacity, even if it is merely her voice for a character. This will be deemed TRUE even if she is not listed on IMDB, provided it is confirmed by credible independent sources.

2. "Deadpool & Wolverine" earns over $284.5 million worldwide during its opening weekend according to reports, and the Hollywood Reporter (or a similar publication) acknowledges it as the highest record for an R-rated film release. The target amount is greater than $284.5 million internationally during this weekend.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Taylor Swift cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine, (b) Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Taylor Swift appears in the movie 'Deadpool and Wolverine' in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. Will still resolve YES if she is not credited on IMDB, if it is still confirmed by independent sources.

(b) Resolves YES if the "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie grosses more than $284.5 million globally in its opening weekend according to reports AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release. The current record is held by the original Deadpool at $284.5 million ($152.2 million domestic).

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Taylor Swift cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine, (b) Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Taylor Swift does not appear in the movie 'Deadpool and Wolverine' in any role, including her voice not being used for a character. Will resolve YES if she is not credited on IMDB, and it is not confirmed by independent sources.

(b) Resolves YES if the "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie grosses $284.5 million or less globally in its opening weekend according to reports AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) does not report it as the record for an R-rated movie release. The current record is held by the original Deadpool at $284.5 million ($152.2 million domestic).

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of the following happening: (a) a Taylor Swift appearance in Deadpool and Wolverine, (b) Deadpool & Wolverine achieving the highest opening weekend ever for an R-rated film?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if Taylor Swift is featured in any capacity in the film 'Deadpool and Wolverine', including merely providing her voice for a character. It will also be considered YES if her participation is not listed on IMDB, provided it is confirmed by reliable independent sources.

(b) This will be marked as YES if the 'Deadpool x Wolverine' crossover film earns over $284.5 million worldwide during its opening weekend according to reports, AND if the Hollywood Reporter (or a similar publication) states that it sets a record for R-rated movie openings. The existing record is held by the original Deadpool, which earned $284.5 million ($152.2 million domestically).

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will Biden not drop out before July 20?
not_P.body: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: In the event that Biden withdraws or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing his campaign before the stroke of midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, the market will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Will Hurd not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Will Hurd going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a resolution of **No**. This question is open to the possibility of additional candidates being included in the future.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is awarded the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; the outcome is exclusively determined by the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20 and (b) Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this condition will be satisfied.
(b) Will Hurd must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Biden does not drop out before July 20 nor (b) Hurd will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(a) If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this condition will not be satisfied.
(b) Hurd must not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is not selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who does not receive the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will take place: (a) Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20 and (b) Hurd becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) The condition will be met if Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to continue his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20.
(b) Hurd must be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This selection is determined exclusively by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than by who is nominated on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, 2024, or (b) Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. (b) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Biden does not drop out before July 20, 2024, and (b) Hurd will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body: (a) Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. (b) Hurd is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of these events will happen: (a) Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20, 2024, or (b) Hurd becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: (a) Biden either withdraws from or is rendered incapable of continuing his campaign before the deadline of July 20, 2024, at midnight Eastern Time. (b) Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

not_P.title: Will Israel not carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Israel will conduct a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered resolved as **Yes** if, after the date this question is released and before May 1, 2024, reliable sources report that an assault linked to Israel has taken place within the territory of Iran resulting in the fatalities of no fewer than five people.

question.title: Will Iran's Guardian Council include Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name on its list of approved candidates for president of Iran?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

not_P.title: Will Iran's Guardian Council exclude Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name from its list of approved candidates for president of Iran?
not_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is not included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

para_P.title: Is Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name going to be part of the approved candidates list by Iran's Guardian Council for the presidential election?
para_P.body: This question will resolve to **Yes** if Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is featured in the Guardian Council of Iran's roster of eligible candidates for the forthcoming presidential election.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, and (b) Iran's Guardian Council include Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name on its list of approved candidates for president of Iran?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

(b) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, nor (b) Iran's Guardian Council include Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name on its list of approved candidates for president of Iran?
not_P.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met:

(a) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

(b) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is not included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of these events will take place: (a) Israel executes a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024, and (b) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name is added to the Guardian Council of Iran's roster of sanctioned presidential candidates?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will resolve to **Yes** if both of the subsequent conditions are satisfied:

(a) After the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, reliable reports confirm that an attack linked to Israel has occurred within the territory of Iran, resulting in the deaths of at least five people.

(b) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad appears on the Guardian Council of Iran's list of eligible candidates for the forthcoming presidential election.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, or (b) Iran's Guardian Council include Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name on its list of approved candidates for president of Iran?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals. (b) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, nor (b) Iran's Guardian Council include Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name on its list of approved candidates for president of Iran?
not_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals. (b) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is not included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following will take place: (a) Israel conducts a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024, or (b) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name is added to the list of candidates approved by Iran's Guardian Council for the presidential election?
para_P.body: This question will be considered **Yes** if at least one of the following happens: (a) After the publication of this question and before May 1, 2024, reliable information emerges that an attack ascribed to Israel has occurred within Iran, resulting in the deaths of no fewer than five people. (b) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is listed among the approved candidates by Iran's Guardian Council for the forthcoming presidential election.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if no credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a Yes if reliable sources indicate that a candidate from the Republican Party has emerged victorious in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases where there is a lack of consensus among popular sources, an official statement or source from Ohio State will be referenced. Should no election occur prior to January 1, 2025, this question will be considered void.

If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

question.title: Will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

For the first condition, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For the second condition, resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency). If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this part will resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Rishi Sunak not be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry concludes as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (2) Rishi Sunak does not secure a seat as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

Regarding the first criterion, it is irrelevant who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively decided by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Concerning the second criterion, resolution should reference [reliable](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official statement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is a candidate (if he is running in any constituency). If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this segment will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

For part (a), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For part (b), if Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this part will resolve as **No**. Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

not_P.title: Will neither Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election nor Rishi Sunak be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, nor (b) Rishi Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

For part (a), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For part (b), if Sunak is not elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this part will resolve as **Yes**. Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

para_P.title: Is it possible that Vivek Ramaswamy becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or that Rishi Sunak does not win a seat in the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if either of the following happens: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Rishi Sunak does not secure election as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election on July 4, 2024.

Regarding part (a), it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; what counts is who the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention) decide to nominate.

As for part (b), if Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the UK general election on July 4, 2024, this part will resolve as **No**. The resolution should reference [reliable](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) news sources or an official declaration from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is running (if he is indeed a candidate in any constituency).

question.title: Will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

not_P.title: Will the European Union not announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has not announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.title: Is it expected that the European Union will declare new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has declared the imposition of new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles entering the EU.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will a group of fewer than 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators not pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless fewer than 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a coalition of no fewer than 5 identified Democratic House Members or US Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have informed local media that they believe Biden's chances of winning in November are slim.

Behind closed doors, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters being shared among House Democrats, and at least one of these would request Biden to conclude his campaign, as per five individuals acquainted with the efforts.

This market will resolve to YES if a coalition of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborates to ask Joe Biden to consider withdrawing from his 2024 re-election campaign, or to encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur through signing a letter similar to what has been reported, or it may take another form, such as a group meeting with Biden in person and collectively requesting him to withdraw.

It is essential that all five individuals are part of the same collective message. If five individuals independently express to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw, it will not suffice for a YES resolution.

Reports involving any number of unnamed Democrats requesting Biden to step aside will not meet the criteria for this market unless at least five qualifying names are publicly disclosed before the market's closing date. In cases where such names are reported but not confirmed with a high degree of certainty, this market will lean towards resolving NO.

If these conditions are not fulfilled before July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The European Union announces new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, and (b) A group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as collectively speaking with Biden. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Reports of unnamed democrats will not satisfy the criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are made public before July 20th. Ambiguous cases will resolve NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) The European Union announces new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, nor (b) A group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has not announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by not signing a letter or in another form such as not collectively speaking with Biden. Not all five individuals must be part of the same group message. Reports of unnamed democrats will not satisfy the criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are not made public before July 20th. Ambiguous cases will resolve YES.

para_P.title: Are both of the following events going to take place: (a) The European Union reveals new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024, and (b) A coalition of at least 5 identified Democratic House Members or US Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, trustworthy sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has declared the implementation of new tariffs or duties that will be levied on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(b) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if a coalition of no fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators collaborates to request Joe Biden to contemplate ceasing his 2024 re-election campaign, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could occur through signing a letter or through another method such as collectively discussing with Biden. All five individuals must be part of the same group communication. Reports of unnamed Democrats will not meet the requirements unless at least 5 qualifying names are disclosed before July 20th. Unclear situations will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur before their respective dates: (a) the EU announce new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles, or (b) a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: 

(a) Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(b) Before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time), a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so. This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient. Reports of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy the criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before the end date. In ambiguous cases, the resolution will err towards NO.

If neither of these criteria are met by their respective dates, this question resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur before their respective dates: (a) the EU announce new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles, nor (b) a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: 

(a) Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(b) Before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time), a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so. This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient. Reports of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy the criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before the end date. In ambiguous cases, the resolution will err towards YES.

If either of these criteria are met by their respective dates, this question resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following events will happen prior to their specified deadlines: (a) the European Union declares new tariffs on electric vehicles from China, or (b) a coalition of no fewer than 5 identified Democratic House members or US Senators press Biden to withdraw from the race?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if one of the following takes place: 

(a) Before July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has made an announcement regarding the implementation of new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(b) Prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time), a coalition consisting of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborates to request Joe Biden to contemplate terminating his 2024 re-election campaign, or to encourage him to do so. This could occur through signing a letter or through another method, such as a group meeting with Biden in person to collectively ask him to withdraw. All five individuals must be part of the same group communication. Five individuals independently expressing to the media their belief that Biden should withdraw is insufficient. Reports of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden and requesting him to step down will not meet the criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are publicly disclosed before the deadline. In cases of ambiguity, the resolution will lean towards NO.

If neither of these conditions is satisfied by their respective deadlines, this question will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Greece qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Greece participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Greece does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Greece not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Greece does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Greece qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Greece set to advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Greece takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualifying for the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Greece fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Lithuania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Lithuania does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Lithuania not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Lithuania does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Lithuania qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Lithuania going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Lithuania competes in a Semi-final and is formally recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Lithuania fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will both Greece and Lithuania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Greece participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final; (2) Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Greece or Lithuania does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will either Greece or Lithuania not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (1) Greece does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final; (2) Lithuania does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If both Greece and Lithuania qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Greece and Lithuania both set to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the following two criteria are fulfilled: (1) Greece competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final; (2) Lithuania competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Greece or Lithuania fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will either Greece or Lithuania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Greece participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Greece nor Lithuania qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Greece nor Lithuania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Greece participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Greece or Lithuania qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that Greece or Lithuania will make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Greece competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Lithuania competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Greece nor Lithuania advances, the inquiry will conclude with a **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but no more than 3 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the difference between Donald Trump and Joe Biden as indicated in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, and reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive number signifies a Trump advantage, whereas a negative number indicates Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public declaration before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement asserting that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be explicit and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States during the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (2) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
(1) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(2) Joe Biden will announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or (2) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
(1) Trump's lead over Biden will be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(2) Joe Biden will announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will take place: (1) Trump's margin over Biden exceeds 2 but does not go beyond 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, and (2) Joe Biden publicly declares before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the nomination for President from the Democratic Party?
para_P.body:
(1) On July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, Trump's margin over Biden will be more than 2 but at most 3. This inquiry will be resolved based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the chart for that date, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value was Trump 2.4 points in front of Biden, which counts as a positive figure of 2.4 for this question.

(2) Before July 15, 2024, Joe Biden will make a public announcement stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This question will be resolved as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. For a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should not leave any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States during the 2024 election cycle. If such a clear statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either Trump's lead over Biden be between 2 and 3 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead.

(b) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

If neither (a) nor (b) occurs, this question will resolve as **No**.

(a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead.

(b) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

If either (a) or (b) occurs, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place:

(a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential race is more than 2 and at most 3, as shown on the chart when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump.

(b) Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign publicly and officially states that he will not pursue nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election. The announcement must be clear and definitive, allowing no possibility that Biden might accept the nomination.

If neither (a) nor (b) occurs, this question will resolve as **No**.
