question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

not_P.title: Will Biden not remain President through end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he remains President through that time.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does cause a NO resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden still hold the presidency by the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden is still the US President at the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution. (An Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be barred or excluded from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially barred or excluded from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The barring or exclusion must be verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will resolve with a "No" if these conditions are not satisfied as of July 15, 2024.

Note: This inquiry does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen after the specified date. It solely concerns whether Donald Trump has been barred from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is barred or excluded from a ballot and subsequently reinstated, resulting in him not being barred or excluded from any ballot as of July 15, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden remains President through the end of July 2024 and (b) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution).

(b) This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Biden remains President through the end of July 2024 nor (b) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he does remain as President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution).

(b) This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is not removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Biden continues as President until the end of July 2024 and (b) Donald Trump is barred or eliminated from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Biden is still the President of the United States by the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date. A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment (i.e., designating his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution. (An Acting President is distinct from the President as per the Constitution).

(b) This question will resolve as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially barred or eliminated from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The confirmation of the removal or barring must come from official state government announcements, court rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The question will resolve as "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may take place after the specified date. It strictly concerns whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is barred or eliminated from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being barred or eliminated from any ballot as of July 15th, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will either Biden remain President through July 2024 or Trump be removed from any primary election ballot under the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will neither Biden remain President through July 2024 nor Trump be removed from any primary election ballot under the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves YES if neither of the following occurs: (a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "Yes" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will still be President by the end of July 2024, or that Trump will be disqualified from any primary election ballot due to the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if one of the following happens: (a) Biden continues to hold the office of the US President until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET); it will be a NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date. A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES answer. (b) By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from being on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This disqualification or prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The answer will be "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024. Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen after the specified date. It directly relates to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position on the grounds mentioned as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then later reinstated, such that he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot as of July 15, the answer will be negative.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

2. None of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Kamala Harris will assume the Presidency by Friday, or that a member of the Trump family will be the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed "Yes" if either of the subsequent events takes place:

1. Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The main source for resolution will be official announcements from the US government, although a consensus of reliable news reports will also be considered.

2. One of the following persons is selected as the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

question.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Liz Cheney not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

not_P.title: Will the Republican Party not retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if no credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If an election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Will Ohio's 6th congressional district, formerly represented by Bill Johnson, be kept by the Republican Party in the special election of 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as Yes if reliable sources indicate that a candidate from the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases of conflicting reports from popular sources, an official Ohio State source or declaration will be referenced. If there is no election conducted prior to January 1, 2025, this question will be rendered void.

(a) Liz Cheney is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection at the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district, previously held by Bill Johnson. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (a) Liz Cheney is chosen as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. In case of conflicting reports, an official source or statement from Ohio will be prioritized. If no election occurs prior to January 1, 2025, this question will be considered void.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Is Biden projected to be the frontrunner on Friday according to 538?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024, indicates that Joe Biden has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump. Conversely, it will resolve with a “No” if Donald Trump is shown to have a higher probability of winning than Joe Biden based on the same forecast. If both candidates are projected to have equal chances, the market will resolve at 50-50.

The source for resolution will be the FiveThirtyEight 2024 presidential election forecast found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically using the data represented by the blue and red trend lines for the resolution date. Any changes in the method used by FiveThirtyEight to calculate these figures will not affect the outcome of this market.

The market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is available. It may not resolve until the July 20 data is released. If no data for July 19 is available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve based on the closest previous data to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution refers to the winning probabilities of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations won by each candidate out of 1,000 will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Poland not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Poland set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Poland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Poland fails to qualify, the inquiry will conclude with a **No**.

question.title: At the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024, will the men's 100m dash winning time break the Olympic record of 9.63s?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete runs the Men's 100M race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63s, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: At the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024, will the men's 100m dash winning time not break the Olympic record of 9.63s?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if no athlete runs the Men's 100M race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63s, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this happens, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will the winning time for the men's 100m sprint at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics surpass the Olympic record of 9.63 seconds?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if any competitor completes the Men's 100M event at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in under 9.63 seconds, based on results published by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or other reliable sources. Conversely, if this does not occur, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥15 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No".

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

not_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win <15 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win less than 15 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No".

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won less than 15 gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

para_P.title: Will Neutral Individual Athletes Achieve 15 or More Gold Medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Neutral Individual Athletes together secure at least 15 gold medals during the 2024 Olympic Games in Paris. The resolution will rely on the official medal count provided by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reputable sources if the IOC does not report. Otherwise, it will be resolved as "No".

If it is confirmed that Neutral Individual Athletes have won 15 or more gold medals before the conclusion of the Games, the market will promptly resolve to "Yes".

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the Paris 2024 Olympics: (a) the men's 100m dash winning time breaks the Olympic record of 9.63s and (b) Individual Neutral Athletes win 15 or more gold medals?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. An athlete runs the Men's 100M race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63s, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources.

2. Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

If either or both of these conditions are not met, this question resolves as **No**.

2. Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "No".

If either or both of these conditions are met, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

not_P.title: Will Kamala Harris not be the Democratic VP?
not_P.body: If Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to yes. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

para_P.title: Is Kamala Harris going to be the Democratic Vice President?
para_P.body: In the event that Kamala Harris is chosen as the Democratic Vice President, this market will conclude with a yes. Conversely, if another individual is appointed as VP, this market will conclude with a no. Any subsequent changes to the VP after the initial nomination will not affect the resolution of this market. The market can come to a conclusion right after the nomination.

question.title: Will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will there not be a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body:
Politico reports:

No safe-seat members have publicly urged Biden out. None of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets that they’ve written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more calm. There are no drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and not even one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people unfamiliar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if there is no group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators working together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by not signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group not speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that not all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving YES.

If these criteria are met before July 20th, this market resolves YES.

para_P.title: Will five or more identified Democratic House Representatives or Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already called for Biden to step aside publicly. Additionally, two vulnerable Democrats have expressed to local media that they believe Biden's chances for victory in November are slim.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several versions of letters being shared among House Democrats, and at least one of these drafts would request Biden to cease his campaign, as reported by five sources familiar with the situation.

This market will resolve to YES if a coalition of at least five named Democratic Party House Representatives or Senators collaborate to suggest to Joe Biden that he consider withdrawing from his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur through signing a letter as mentioned above, or through alternative means such as a group meeting with Biden in person to collectively request his withdrawal.

For a YES resolution, it is necessary that all five individuals participate in the same group communication. If five individuals independently express to the media that they believe Biden should withdraw, that will not be enough for a YES outcome.

Any reports involving an unspecified number of Democrats reaching out to Biden and urging him to step down will not fulfill the requirements of this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed before the market closes. In cases where names are reported but not verified with certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not satisfied by July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's AND will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) On July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). (2) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. At least 5 qualifying names must be made public before this market's end date. In ambiguous cases, this market will err towards resolving NO.

not_P.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be less than or equal to Apple's OR will there be no group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressuring Biden to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body: This question resolves Yes if either of the following conditions is met: (1) On July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is less than or equal to that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). (2) There is no group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators working together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This means that either no such group exists, or if five individuals express their opinions separately, it does not count as a sufficient YES resolution. In ambiguous cases, this market will err towards resolving YES.

para_P.title: Will Nvidia's market value exceed that of Apple's on July 17, 2024, and will a coalition of no fewer than five identified Democratic House Members or US Senators urge Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20th?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization surpasses that of Apple, as reported by Companies Market Cap, verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). (2) A coalition of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborates to request Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be accomplished through signing a letter or another method such as a group discussion with Biden in person, collectively urging him to withdraw. All five individuals must be part of the same collective communication. If five individuals independently express to reporters their belief that Biden should withdraw, this will not suffice for a YES resolution. At least five qualifying names must be publicly disclosed before the conclusion of this market. In cases of uncertainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

question.title: Will either Nvidia's market cap exceed Apple's on July 17, 2024, or will at least 5 named Democratic lawmakers pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves YES if either of the following occurs: (a) On July 17, 2024, the market capitalization of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). (b) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20, 2024 (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message, and reports of unnamed democrats must have at least 5 qualifying names made public before the end date. If neither of these criteria are met, this question resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will neither Nvidia's market cap exceed Apple's on July 17, 2024, nor will fewer than 5 named Democratic lawmakers pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves YES if neither of the following occurs: (a) On July 17, 2024, the market capitalization of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). (b) A group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20, 2024 (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message, and reports of unnamed democrats must have at least 5 qualifying names made public before the end date. If either of these criteria are met, this question resolves NO.

para_P.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization surpass that of Apple, or will a minimum of five identified Democratic lawmakers urge Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if one of the following takes place: (a) As of July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market cap is higher than Apple's, as reported by Companies Market Cap and verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). (b) A coalition of at least five specified Democratic Party members from the US House or Senate collaborates to persuade Joe Biden to contemplate stepping down from his 2024 re-election bid, or to strongly encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20, 2024 (Pacific Time). This may occur through a signed letter or other means, such as a group meeting with Biden to collectively request his withdrawal. All five members must be part of the same communication, and any reports of unnamed Democrats must disclose at least five qualifying names before the deadline. If neither condition is fulfilled, this question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will a swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

not_P.title: Will a swimmer not win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals does not compete in the swimming events.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a swimmer to secure the highest number of gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: The inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the competitor who achieves the most gold medals in the 2024 Olympics participates in swimming competitions.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

not_P.title: Will the same nation not win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as Yes if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will any single country secure victories in multiple women's team sports during the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with No if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) achieve gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

Conversely, for the answer to be **Yes**, the same NOC must have claimed victory in at least two of these competitions.

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) A swimmer wins the most gold medals, and (b) The same nation wins more than one women's team sport?
question.body:
(a) The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

(b) The question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following NOT occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) A swimmer wins the most gold medals, or (b) The same nation wins more than one women's team sport?
not_P.body:
(a) The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals does NOT compete in the swimming events.

(b) The question resolves as **Yes** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) DO win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, the same NOC must NOT have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that during the 2024 Paris Olympics, (a) a swimmer secures the highest number of gold medals, and (b) the same country achieves victories in more than one women's team sport?
para_P.body:
(a) The answer will be **Yes** if the competitor with the most gold medals in the 2024 Olympics participates in swimming events.

(b) The answer will be **No** if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) each claim gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. In all other cases, the same NOC must have secured at least two of these championships, resulting in the answer being **Yes**.

question.title: Will either a swimmer win the most gold medals or the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

1. The athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.
2. The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one women's team sport. Specifically, this means that the same NOC must have won at least two of the following events: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. If women's teams representing eight different NOCs win gold in these eight team sports, the question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither a swimmer win the most gold medals nor the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs:

1. The athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.
2. The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one women's team sport. Specifically, this means that the same NOC must not have won at least two of the following events: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. If women's teams representing eight different NOCs win gold in these eight team sports, the question resolves as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a swimmer to secure the highest number of gold medals or for one nation to achieve victories in multiple women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met:

1. The competitor who earns the most gold medals at the 2024 Olympics participates in swimming events.
2. A single National Olympic Committee (NOC) claims gold in more than one women's team sport. This entails that the same NOC must have succeeded in at least two of the following disciplines: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. If gold medals are awarded to women's teams from eight different NOCs across these eight team sports, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will Czechia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

not_P.title: Will Biden not remain President through end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he remains President until then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a NO resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Is it possible for Biden to stay in office as President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with YES if Biden is still the US President at the end of July 2024 (ET); it will be answered with NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not result in a YES answer. (An Acting President is distinct from a President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President before July 26, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden remains President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No". The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

(b) Resolves YES if Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris does not become President or Acting President before July 26, 2024, nor (b) Joe Biden does not remain President through the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is not formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No". The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

(b) Resolves YES if Joe Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will happen: (a) Kamala Harris is appointed as President or Acting President prior to July 26, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden continues to serve as President until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. If not, the market will result in a "No". The main source for resolution will be official announcements from the US government, but credible news reports will also be taken into account.

(b) It will resolve as YES if Joe Biden remains in office as US President until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET); it will resolve as NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date. A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment (i.e. appointing his VP as Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (Acting President is distinct from President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will either Kamala Harris be President by Friday or Biden remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves to "Yes" if either of the following occurs: (a) Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET; or (b) Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET) without resigning, dying, or otherwise ceasing to be President before then. The primary resolution source for (a) will be official information from the US government, with a consensus of credible reporting also being used. For (b), temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a "No" resolution since Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

not_P.title: Will neither Kamala Harris be President by Friday nor Biden remain President through the end of July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves to "Yes" if neither of the following occurs: (a) Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET; or (b) Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET) without resigning, dying, or otherwise ceasing to be President before then. The primary resolution source for (a) will be official information from the US government, with a consensus of credible reporting also being used. For (b), temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a "Yes" resolution since Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Kamala Harris to become President by Friday or for Biden to continue as President until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if one of the following happens: (a) Kamala Harris is officially named as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET; or (b) Joe Biden remains in office as US President until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET) without resigning, passing away, or otherwise ending his presidency before that date. The main source for determining (a) will be official announcements from the US government, supplemented by a consensus of reliable news reports. For (b), a temporary handover of power under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) will not result in a "No" answer, as Acting President is constitutionally distinct from President.

question.title: Will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if France place in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

not_P.title: Will France not place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve positively if France does not place in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

para_P.title: Will France finish among the top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if France finishes in the top 5 (ties are considered positive outcomes) at the Olympic Games scheduled for 2024. It will be deemed unclear if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

The ranking of the medal table is determined by the total count of medals earned by each competing nation, arranged by:

1. Quantity of Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie at 1) Quantity of Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie at 2) Quantity of Bronze Medals

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games: (a) Sha'Carri Richardson wins a gold medal, and (b) France places in the Top 5?
question.body:
This question resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Sha'Carri Richardson wins a gold medal in any event at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. Track and field will start on Thursday, Aug. 1, and conclude on Sunday, Aug. 11. Sha'Carri Richardson will compete on the following days:
   - Women's 100m: Friday, Aug. 2, to Saturday, Aug. 3
   - Women's 4x100m Relay (lineups not yet announced): Thursday, Aug. 8, to Friday, Aug. 9

2. France places in the top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics. This means France must be in the top 5 of the medal table, which is calculated by the number of Gold Medals, followed by Silver Medals in case of a tie, and then Bronze Medals. Ties in placement resolve positively.

If both conditions are met, the question resolves YES. If either or both conditions are not met, it resolves NO. The question will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games: (a) Sha'Carri Richardson does not win a gold medal, or (b) France does not place in the Top 5?
not_P.body:

1. Sha'Carri Richardson does not win a gold medal in any event at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. Track and field will start on Thursday, Aug. 1, and conclude on Sunday, Aug. 11. Sha'Carri Richardson will compete on the following days:
   - Women's 100m: Friday, Aug. 2, to Saturday, Aug. 3
   - Women's 4x100m Relay (lineups not yet announced): Thursday, Aug. 8, to Friday, Aug. 9

2. France does not place in the top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics. This means France must not be in the top 5 of the medal table, which is calculated by the number of Gold Medals, followed by Silver Medals in case of a tie, and then Bronze Medals. Ties in placement resolve positively.

If at least one of the conditions is met, the question resolves YES. If both conditions are met, it resolves NO. The question will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place during the 2024 Paris Olympic Games: (a) Sha'Carri Richardson secures a gold medal, and (b) France finishes in the Top 5?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled:

1. Sha'Carri Richardson secures a gold medal in any event at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. The track and field events will commence on Thursday, August 1, and conclude on Sunday, August 11. Sha'Carri Richardson is scheduled to compete on these dates:
   - Women's 100m: Friday, August 2, to Saturday, August 3
   - Women's 4x100m Relay (lineups not yet disclosed): Thursday, August 8, to Friday, August 9

2. France finishes among the top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics. This indicates that France must rank in the top 5 of the medal standings, which are determined by the number of Gold Medals, followed by Silver Medals in the event of a tie, and then Bronze Medals. Any ties in ranking will be resolved in favor of the placement.

If both criteria are satisfied, the question will be answered with a YES. If either or both criteria are not satisfied, it will be answered with a NO. The question will remain unclear if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

question.title: Will either Sha'Carri Richardson win a gold medal or France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public declaration before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement confirming that he will neither pursue nor accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 electoral process.

If such a conclusive announcement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

not_P.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain less than 3% among Manifold respondents?
not_P.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by less than 3% when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% increase in support among Manifold voters?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both of which conclude on July 6. One poll presents a hypothetical ballot featuring Joe Biden, while the other includes a generic Democrat.

Public sentiment surveys frequently indicate that Joe Biden trails Donald Trump by a margin greater than the margin of error, whereas all other Democrats surveyed in similar hypothetical scenarios either lead or are within the margin of error. Do Manifold participants reflect the broader electorate?

This market will be marked YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll exceeds that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, the formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is at least 0.03. If not, the answer will be NO.

The polls and this question will not resolve as N/A and will stay open until the closing time regardless of circumstances.
