question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will Biden not drop out before July 20?
not_P.body: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is there a chance Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden decide to withdraw or become incapable of continuing his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If he does not, then this market will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The question will resolve as "No" if he has been officially removed or blocked from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. 

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially excluded or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion or prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be deemed "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that could happen after the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the outlined grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or prevented from a ballot and then subsequently reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not excluded or prevented from any ballot, the inquiry resolves negatively.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20 AND will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not met. Note: For condition (b), the question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after July 15, 2024. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of that date. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Biden not drop out before July 20 OR will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if at least one of the following conditions is met:

(a) Joe Biden does not drop out or is otherwise able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The lack of removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if both of these conditions are met. Note: For condition (b), the question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after July 15, 2024. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of that date. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will exit the race prior to July 20 AND that Trump will be barred or eliminated from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

(a) Joe Biden withdraws or is otherwise incapable of continuing the campaign before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time.

(b) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially barred or eliminated from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The barring or elimination must be validated through official state government statements, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial declarations will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if either or both of these criteria are not satisfied. Note: For criterion (b), the inquiry does not take into account legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may occur after July 15, 2024. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been barred from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the specified grounds as of that date. If Trump is barred or eliminated from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not barred or eliminated from any ballot, the inquiry resolves negatively.

question.title: Will either Biden drop out before July 20 or Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will neither Biden drop out before July 20 nor Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must not be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will suffice for resolution. The question does account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is not removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20, or that Donald Trump will be barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to continue his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20.

(b) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially prohibited or removed from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This prohibition or removal must be validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or credible news reports. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial declarations will not be sufficient for determining the outcome. The question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or reversals that may happen after the specified date. It strictly addresses whether Donald Trump has been barred from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the stated conditions as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is barred from a ballot and then later reinstated, meaning that as of July 15 he is not barred from any ballot, the answer will be negative.

question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government

not_P.title: Will Scotland not hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is no referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Scotland will conduct an official referendum on its independence prior to May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered resolved as **Yes** if Scotland carries out a referendum concerning its independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024. The referendum may be categorized as an "advisory" referendum, meaning it does not need to have any legal binding consequences.

A referendum will not be recognized as resolved if it is of the “wildcat” or “Catalan” variety, where the UK government has not granted permission for the vote, nor if it is organized by civil society groups. For the referendum to be valid, it must have the approval of the London government.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Scotland holds an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024, (b) The linked market gets at least 377 traders by end of July 15, 2023?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is no referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, or this referendum is not held before May 3, 2024. This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect. It shall be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to lack the consent of the London government.

(b) Resolves YES if the market embedded in the provided link has fewer than 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise. The link to the market is: https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Scotland conducts an official and authorized referendum on independence prior to May 3, 2024, (b) The specified market attracts a minimum of 377 traders by the end of July 15, 2023?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if a referendum takes place in Scotland concerning its independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum occurs before May 3, 2024. The referendum may be classified as an "advisory" referendum; it does not need to have any legal enforceability. It will not be considered resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” type of referendum where the UK government has refused to authorize the vote, nor by a vote organized by civil society groups. A referendum must be recognized as having the approval of the London government.

(b) Resolves YES if the market linked in the provided URL has 377 traders before the market closes (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO in all other cases. The link to the market is: https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g

question.title: Will Georgia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Georgia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Georgia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Georgia set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Georgia takes part in a Semi-final and is formally recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For all other results, the answer will be **No**.

not_P.title: Will Estonia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

para_P.title: Is Estonia set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Estonia takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Estonia fails to qualify, the inquiry will conclude with a **No**.

question.title: Will both Georgia and Estonia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Georgia and Estonia participate in a Semi-final and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Georgia or Estonia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Georgia nor Estonia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither Georgia nor Estonia participate in a Semi-final or are not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Georgia or Estonia qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are both Georgia and Estonia set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if both Georgia and Estonia take part in a Semi-final and are officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Georgia or Estonia fails to qualify, the inquiry will conclude as **No**.

question.title: Will either Georgia or Estonia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Estonia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Georgia nor Estonia qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Georgia nor Estonia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Estonia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Georgia or Estonia qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Georgia or Estonia make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following situations occurs: (a) Georgia is involved in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will be answered with **No** if neither Georgia nor Estonia qualifies.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

not_P.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet not cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
not_P.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post does not cover the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden decide to withdraw, will a reputable news source report the story no less than 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
The question will be deemed TRUE if a prominent and trustworthy news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden makes his official announcement of withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Coverage from local news, conspiracy websites, or statements by individual users on Manifold will not suffice.

This market will be marked as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump Jr. going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other contenders will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently discussed; additional options may emerge later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the date of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively determined by who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance? (2) Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(1) This resolves as YES if a major and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before his official announcement. The question is N/A if he does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention. 

(2) This resolves as YES if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, regardless of who is nominated on the election day itself.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet not cover the story at least 6 hours in advance? (2) Will Donald Trump Jr. not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(1) This resolves as YES if no major and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before his official announcement. The question is N/A if he does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention. 

(2) This resolves as YES if Donald Trump Jr. is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, regardless of who is nominated on the election day itself.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden withdraws from the race, will a credible news source report the event at least 6 hours prior? Additionally, will Donald Trump Jr. be chosen as the Republican candidate for the upcoming 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(1) This will be considered YES if a prominent and trustworthy news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post announces Joe Biden's withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours ahead of his formal declaration. The question is N/A if he has not withdrawn by the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention. 

(2) This will be deemed YES if Donald Trump Jr. is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, regardless of the nominee chosen on the day of the election.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) If Joe Biden drops out, a reliable media outlet covers the story at least 6 hours in advance (b) Donald Trump Jr. is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) If Joe Biden drops out, this question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient. (b) This question resolves YES if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as NO. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future. not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) If Joe Biden drops out, a reliable media outlet covers the story at least 6 hours in advance (b) Donald Trump Jr. is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(a) If Joe Biden drops out, this question resolves YES if no big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) This question resolves YES if Donald Trump Jr. is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as YES. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future. para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following happens: (a) Should Joe Biden withdraw, a reputable news source reports the event at least 6 hours prior (b) Donald Trump Jr. becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) Should Joe Biden withdraw, this question will be marked as YES if a major and trustworthy news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports on the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc. Coverage by local news, conspiracy websites, or comments from individual users on Manifold will not suffice. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) This question will be marked as YES if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be marked as NO. This question is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; additional options may be included later. It will be determined solely by who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024, that he will not be accepting the Democratic Party's presidential nomination?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be explicit and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not issued before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

not_P.title: Will Russia not have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as not under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

para_P.body:
This inquiry will resolve as **Yes** if, when checked by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as belonging to any of the following classifications:



- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine

- Any additional classifications established by ISW that signify Ukrainian control of the area or the absence of Russian control over the area.

The announcement must be unequivocal and final, allowing no possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a clear statement is not provided before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will be resolved as **No**.

(b) This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, when checked by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates that the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E fall under any of the following classifications:
- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other classifications established by ISW that signify Russian control of the area
The inquiry will be resolved as **No** if the area is not classified in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:
- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
- Any other classifications created by ISW that signify Ukrainian control of the area or a lack of Russian control of the area.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, or (b) Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

(b) On June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the categories indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location.

If neither (a) nor (b) occurs, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, nor (b) Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs:

(a) Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

(b) On June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the categories indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location.

If either (a) or (b) occurs, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following will take place: (a) Joe Biden publicly declares by July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, or (b) Russia takes control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following happens:

(a) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and official public statement indicating that he will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be explicit and definitive, leaving no possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for the presidency in the 2024 election.

(b) On June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates that the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E are classified under any categories signaling Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other classifications established by ISW that denote Russian dominance over the area.

If neither (a) nor (b) takes place, this question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT not be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
not_P.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If available in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or available to (for example) minors, this will still resolve negatively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves negatively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be accessible to the general public in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
The resolution of this question will be **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the general public in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

Here, "accessible to the general public" means that the typical situation for individuals in the EU is that they can reach it without utilizing a VPN (although it may require a payment). If it is not accessible in specific EU nations (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or not accessible to (for instance) minors, it will still be considered a positive resolution, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

In this context, "ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be resolved positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries into systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Malta not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Malta set to advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if they do not advance, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Serbia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Serbia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For all other countries, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Serbia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Serbia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For all other countries, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Serbia going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Serbia competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. For every other nation, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will both Malta and Serbia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Malta and Serbia participate in a Semi-final and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Malta nor Serbia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither Malta nor Serbia participate in a Semi-final or if they are not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both do qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Malta and Serbia set to advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if both Malta and Serbia take part in a Semi-final and are officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both fail to qualify, the inquiry will conclude as **No**.

question.title: Will either Malta or Serbia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Malta participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Serbia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Malta nor Serbia qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Malta nor Serbia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Malta participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Serbia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Malta or Serbia qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will either Malta or Serbia make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Malta competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Serbia competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Malta nor Serbia advances, the question will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

not_P.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" not be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is not higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

para_P.title: Will the opening weekend earnings of "Deadpool & Wolverine" surpass those of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" together?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the opening weekend earnings for **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) exceed $185,548,391, which is the total of the box office openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.body:

Context: 

"Trap" is the next film directed by the legendary M. Night Shyamalan (with a great trailer).

"Old" - C+

This question is answered with **Yes** if either of the following happens:

(a) The domestic box office debut for **Deadpool & Wolverine**, as reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1), exceeds $185,548,391, which is the total of the box office openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

(b) "Trap" (2024) receives a CinemaScore of B or better. It is considered NO if it gets a B- or lower. If a CinemaScore is not available for some reason, this will resolve as N/A. "Trap" is the upcoming film directed by M. Night Shyamalan, who is known for his films that have received a range of CinemaScores such as "Split" (B+), "Glass" (B), "Old" (C+), and "Knock at the Cabin" (C).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but remain at or below 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title:
Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)	
 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

not_P.title: Will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) not be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must not be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: Is the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) expected to be greater on July 20, 2024 compared to July 20, 2023?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be determined by the data published by the St. Louis Fed at this link: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The value reported for July 20, 2024 must exceed the value reported for July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points on July 15, 2024, as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.
   
2. The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) reported by the St. Louis Fed on July 20, 2024, is greater than the reported value on July 20, 2023.

Both conditions must be satisfied for this question to resolve as YES.

not_P.title: Will either of the following not occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or (b) the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if at least one of the following conditions is not met:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is not greater than 2 or not less than or equal to 3 points on July 15, 2024, as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.
   
2. The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) reported by the St. Louis Fed on July 20, 2024, is not greater than the reported value on July 20, 2023.

At least one of the conditions must not be satisfied for this question to resolve as YES.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 in the 538 national polling average, and will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) show a Year-over-Year increase on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed YES if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled:

1. According to 538's national polling average, Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden that is greater than 2 and at most 3 points on July 15, 2024, as documented by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure represents a lead for Trump.
   
2. The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS), as reported by the St. Louis Fed on July 20, 2024, must exceed the value recorded on July 20, 2023.

Both criteria need to be met for this inquiry to conclude as YES.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Tucker Carlson not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Tucker Carlson is selected, it will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Tucker Carlson going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other individual is chosen, it will conclude with a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; additional candidates may emerge later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is based solely on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will Biden not drop out before July 20?
not_P.body: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Will Biden withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden withdraw or be unable to proceed with the campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body:
(a) Tucker Carlson will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This decision is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Biden will drop out if he is unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. If he does not drop out by this time, the answer will be **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election nor (b) Biden drop out before July 20?
not_P.body:
(a) Tucker Carlson will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. If any other candidate is selected, this will resolve as **Yes**. This decision is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Biden will not drop out if he is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. If he does drop out by this time, the answer will be **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Tucker Carlson becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
(a) Tucker Carlson will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is chosen by the Republican National Convention as their nominee. If any other individual is chosen, the outcome will be **No**. This determination is based exclusively on the decision made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Biden will withdraw from the race if he is unable to continue before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time. If he remains in the race past this deadline, the response will be **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Biden drops out before July 20?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention). (b) If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Biden drops out before July 20?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Tucker Carlson is selected, this question will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention). (b) If Biden does not drop out or is otherwise able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible for either of the following to happen: (a) Tucker Carlson becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Biden withdraws before July 20?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if at least one of the following happens: (a) Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other individual is chosen, it will be considered **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; additional candidates may emerge later. For the purposes of this question, it does not matter who the Republican nominee is on the date of the 2024 US election; the outcome is solely based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention). (b) If Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to continue his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will be resolved as yes. If not, it will resolve as no.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The absence of removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reputable media sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution.

This inquiry will be deemed "No" if these conditions are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen after the specified date. It solely addresses whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then later reinstated, such that on July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the answer will be negative.

para_P.title: Is Francis Suarez going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This inquiry is not confined to the candidates currently under consideration; additional options may emerge later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election; it is determined solely by the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is shown to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, this market will conclude with a “No” if Donald Trump is projected to have a better chance of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. In the event that Biden and Trump have equal chances, this market will result in a 50-50 outcome.

The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the values indicated by the blue and red trend lines for the resolution date of this market. Any changes in the methodology that FiveThirtyEight uses to calculate its data will not affect the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as data for July 20 is available. It may not resolve until the data for July 20 is accessible. If there are no data points for July 19 available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the closest previous figures to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the winning odds of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100 rounded to one decimal place (for example, "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Francis Suarez becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) FiveThirtyEight indicates Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This query will be answered with **Yes** if Francis Suarez is chosen as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is open to any candidates, not just those currently mentioned; additional candidates may emerge later.

For this question, the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; it depends solely on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is forecasted to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election prediction for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump is projected to have a higher likelihood of winning than Joe Biden based on the FiveThirtyEight forecast for that same date. If both candidates are shown to have equal chances, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution will rely on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically using the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines for the resolution date of this market. Any changes in how FiveThirtyEight computes its statistics will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. It may not conclude until the July 20 data is available. If data for July 19 is not accessible by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve based on the closest previous figures to July 19.

Please be aware that the resolution pertains to the winning odds for each candidate expressed as a percentage out of 100, reported to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations won by each candidate out of 1,000 will NOT be taken into account.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. 

(b) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This is based on the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this part resolves 50-50. The resolution will occur when datapoints for July 20 become available, or the nearest previous figures to July 19 if no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either (a) Francis Suarez becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) FiveThirtyEight indicates Biden as the leading contender on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if at least one of the following happens:

(a) Francis Suarez is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is based exclusively on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. This is determined by the data shown on the blue and red trend lines in FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast. If Biden and Trump are shown to have equal chances, this segment resolves at 50-50. The resolution will take place when data for July 20 is released, or the closest prior figures to July 19 if data for July 19 is not available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET.

question.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
question.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.
