not_P.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) does not release a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting AND the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: [Short Fuse] Will Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) recommend that Tesla investors oppose Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation plan or the re-election of Kimbal Musk?

If not, the question will be answered with **No**.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than th..."The Wolverine" combined?
question.body:
Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25850/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if the domestic box office opening for the Deadpool & Wolverine reported by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for Deadpool (2016) and The Wolverine (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

(a) This will be marked as YES if Taylor Swift is featured in the film "Deadpool & Wolverine" in any capacity, including just her voice for a character. It will still be considered YES even if she is not listed on IMDB, provided it is verified by independent sources. 

(b) This will be marked as YES if the domestic box office debut for "Deadpool & Wolverine" as reported by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page surpasses $185,548,391, which is the total of the box office openings for Deadpool (2016) and The Wolverine (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752. The resolution of this question will align with the original on Metaculus. Once the original question is resolved, its outcome will automatically apply to this market. Further details can be found on Metaculus.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and do not cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland not to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be used to declare Biden incapacitated prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other pertinent authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the responsibilities and duties of his position" and allows the Vice President to act as President before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not applicable. Biden's own invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

Background: A Republican legislator has requested Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not die before Saturday?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's death prior to the market closing on Friday, July 26th. 

If not, it will be considered a NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 and (b) Joe Biden die before the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this condition. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count for this condition. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024.

If both (a) and (b) occur, the question resolves YES. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 nor (b) Joe Biden die before the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves YES if neither of the following conditions are met:

(a) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this condition. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count for this condition. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024.

If neither (a) nor (b) occur, the question resolves YES. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will take place: (a) Biden is officially declared incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024 and (b) Joe Biden passes away before the conclusion of Friday, July 26th, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if both of the subsequent conditions are satisfied:

(a) The Vice President alongside a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent entity) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and permits the Vice President to act as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this condition. Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., does not fulfill this condition. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not apply here.

(b) There is an official declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024.

If both (a) and (b) take place, the inquiry will resolve to YES. If not, it will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur before August 2024: (a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4, or (b) Joe Biden dies?
question.body:
(a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Joe Biden dies: Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur before August 2024: (a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4, nor (b) Joe Biden dies?
not_P.body:
(a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) does not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Joe Biden dies: Resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens prior to August 2024: (a) Biden is officially deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment, or (b) Joe Biden passes away?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden is officially deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment: This will be considered YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other pertinent body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office" and allows the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is not applicable.

(b) Joe Biden passes away: This will be considered YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, it will be NO.

question.title: Will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

not_P.body:

The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a lack of new commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has not accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of dissatisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be less rigorous than "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if they do not advance, the inquiry will be regarded as **No**.

question.title: Will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if France place in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

not_P.title: Will France not place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve positively if France does not place in the top 5 (ties resolve negatively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

para_P.title: Will France finish among the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if France secures a position in the top 5 (ties are considered affirmative) during the Olympics taking place in 2024. It will be regarded as uncertain if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

The medal standings are determined by summing the total medals earned by each competing nation and ranking them based on:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie at 1) Total Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie at 2) Total Bronze Medals

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) At least 24 world records will be broken (b) France will place in the Top 5?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (1) The number of world records broken is 24 or greater. (2) France places in the top 5 in the medal table. The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by: (1) Number of Gold Medals, (2) (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals, (3) (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals. The question will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

not_P.title: Will not both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) At least 24 world records will be broken (b) France will not place in the Top 5?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is not met during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (1) The number of world records broken is less than 24. (2) France does not place in the top 5 in the medal table. The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by: (1) Number of Gold Medals, (2) (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals, (3) (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals. The question will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) A minimum of 24 world records will be surpassed (b) France will finish within the Top 5?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (1) The count of world records surpassed is 24 or more. (2) France secures a position in the top 5 of the medal standings. The medal standings are determined by summing the total medals earned by each competing nation and ranking by: (1) Quantity of Gold Medals, (2) (In case of a tie for 1st) Quantity of Silver Medals, (3) (In case of a tie for 2nd) Quantity of Bronze Medals. The inquiry will be left uncertain if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

question.title: Will either at least 24 world records be broken or France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) The number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater. (b) France places in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals. The question resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 24 world records be broken and France not place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) The number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater. (b) France places in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals. The question resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 24 world records be set or will France secure a spot in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry is answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) The total number of world records established during the Paris Olympics reaches 24 or more. (b) France finishes in the top 5 (ties are counted positively) at the Olympics scheduled for 2024. The ranking of the medal table is determined by the overall count of medals earned by each participating nation, ordered by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (In case of a tie for 1) Number of Silver Medals 3. (In case of a tie for 2) Number of Bronze Medals. The question remains unclear if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will the Democratic Party experience a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if only a single ballot is necessary, then this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
not_P.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows fewer than 10 Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20?
para_P.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any moment prior to midnight July 20 Central Time, it is evident that 10 or more Democratic Senators are present, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 and (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

(b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20: Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 nor (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
not_P.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

(b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20: Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at no point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) the Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024 and (b) at least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20?
para_P.body:
(a) The Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Democratic Party necessitates more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is needed, then this inquiry will conclude as **No**.

(b) At least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20: Source for resolution: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If it is evidenced at any moment before midnight July 20 Central Time that 10 or more Democratic Senators have called for this, this market will resolve to yes. If not, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (1) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024, or (2) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
1. Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this resolves as **No**.

2. 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20: Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, this resolves to yes. Otherwise, it resolves to no.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024, nor (2) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
not_P.body:
1. Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this resolves as **No**. Therefore, this will resolve as **No** if the Democratic Party requires only one round of voting.

2. 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20: Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, this resolves to yes. Otherwise, it resolves to no. Therefore, this will resolve as **No** if there are fewer than 10 Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out before July 20.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following happens: (1) Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024, or (2) at least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20?
para_P.body:
1. Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024: This will be marked as **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is needed, then this will be marked as **No**.

2. At least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20: Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If at any time before midnight July 20 Central Time, it is indicated that 10 or more Democratic Senators are calling for Biden to step down, this will be marked as yes. If not, it will be marked as no.

question.title: Will Norway qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Norway does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Norway not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Norway does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Norway qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Norway set to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Norway competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Norway fails to qualify, the inquiry will be deemed **No**.

question.title: Will Switzerland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Switzerland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Switzerland not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Switzerland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Switzerland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Switzerland going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Switzerland competes in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Switzerland fails to qualify, the response will be **No**.

question.title: Will both Norway and Switzerland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Norway or Switzerland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Norway nor Switzerland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occur: (a) Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, nor (b) Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Norway or Switzerland does qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are both Norway and Switzerland set to advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if both of the following conditions are satisfied: (a) Norway takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Switzerland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Norway or Switzerland fails to qualify, the inquiry will be marked as **No**.

question.title: Will either Norway or Switzerland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Norway or Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Norway nor Switzerland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Norway nor Switzerland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither Norway nor Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Norway or Switzerland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that Norway or Switzerland will make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if either Norway or Switzerland competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if neither Norway nor Switzerland qualifies, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden declare his refusal of the Democratic nomination for President before July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden make a public announcement prior to July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for the position of President?

This resolves identically to the original question on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

A Yes resolution will occur if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and official statement indicating that he will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election.

For a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear-cut and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility of Biden accepting the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a conclusive announcement is not made by 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, the question will resolve as No.

Further details and background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question resolves, its outcome will automatically apply to this market. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and unequivocal. Please reach out to @jskf for early resolution requests or to report any issues.

question.title: Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will the US government not end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) does not officially terminate or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this happens, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will the United States government terminate its contract that permits Verisign to oversee the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD prior to August 3, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if the US Department of Commerce (DOC) formally ends or allows to expire its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, which acknowledges Verisign's administration of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) before August 3, 2024. If this does not occur, the resolution will be **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, AND (b) The US government ends its agreement with Verisign to manage the .com TLD before August 3, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

(b) Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024? This resolves as Yes if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD).

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following NOT occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, OR (b) The US government does not end its agreement with Verisign to manage the .com TLD before August 3, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden NOT announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if either after 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle, or if his statement is ambiguous and allows for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

(b) Will the US government NOT end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024? This resolves as Yes if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) does not officially terminate or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD).

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Joe Biden makes an announcement prior to July 15, 2024, stating he will not seek the Democratic nomination for President, AND (b) The US government concludes its contract with Verisign to oversee the .com TLD before August 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This is considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign publicly and officially states that he will not run for or accept the nomination of his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election. The announcement must be clear and definitive, with no indication that Biden would accept the nomination.

(b) Will the US government terminate its agreement that permits Verisign to manage the authoritative registry for the .com TLD, prior to August 3, 2024? This is determined to be Yes if, before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially ends or allows its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign to lapse, which acknowledges Verisign's role in managing the .com generic top-level domain (TLD).

question.title: Will either of the following occur before their respective deadlines: (a) Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) the US government ends its agreement with Verisign for the .com TLD?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made by the deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024? This resolves as Yes if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this resolves as No.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur before their respective deadlines: (a) Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, nor (b) the US government ends its agreement with Verisign for the .com TLD?
not_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is made by the deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Will the US government not end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024? This resolves as Yes if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce does not officially terminate or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does happen, this resolves as No.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens prior to their specified deadlines: (a) Joe Biden declares he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) the US government cancels its contract with Verisign for the .com TLD?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be answered with Yes if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, either Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and official statement that he will not seek or accept the nomination of his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be explicit and definitive, with no indication that Biden might accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the upcoming election cycle. If such a declaration is not made by the deadline, the answer will be No.

(b) Will the US government terminate its agreement with Verisign that allows it to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024? This will be answered with Yes if the US Department of Commerce officially ends or lets lapse its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign regarding the management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD) before August 3, 2024. If this does not occur, the answer will be No.

question.title: Will Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) close sub $100 per share by 7/31?
question.body: This market resolves to YES if NVDA closes below 100$ on any day before 7/31.

not_P.title: Will Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) close at $100 per share or more by 7/31?
not_P.body: This market resolves to YES if NVDA closes at $100 or more on any day before 7/31.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) to finish under $100 per share by July 31?
para_P.body: This market will conclude with a YES if NVDA ends the day below $100 at any point prior to July 31.

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

not_P.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI not increase by more than 0.1% in July?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 does not increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The data used for this determination will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will rely on the precise value without rounding.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump Jr. going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be answered with **No**. This question is open to the possibility of other candidates being considered in the future, not just those currently mentioned.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the resolution depends solely on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

not_P.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain less than 3% among Manifold respondents?
not_P.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by less than 3% when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden is the opponent instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump receive at least a 3% increase in support among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to choose Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other inquires about a generic Democrat on the same hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Surveys of public opinion frequently indicate that Joe Biden trails Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat in hypothetical scenarios either leads or is within the margin of error. Do the Manifold participants reflect the general population?

This market will confirm YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls conclude.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the formula for poll 1 minus the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the outcome is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never result in N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time, regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump Jr. becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
(a) Donald Trump Jr. will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is irrespective of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Trump will gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the poll with Joe Biden exceeds that in the poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or more when both polls close on July 6. The formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)), and the difference between the polls must be >= 0.03 for a YES resolution.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following NOT occur: (a) Donald Trump Jr. does not become the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Trump does not gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
not_P.body:
(a) Donald Trump Jr. will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is irrespective of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Trump will not gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the poll with Joe Biden does not exceed that in the poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or more when both polls close on July 6. The formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)), and the difference between the polls must be < 0.03 for a NO resolution.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Donald Trump Jr. is chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Trump receives at least 3% support among Manifold respondents when compared to Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat?
para_P.body:
(a) Donald Trump Jr. will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is nominated by the Republican National Convention. This decision is independent of who is declared the Republican candidate on the day of the 2024 US election; it is entirely based on the delegates from the Republican National Convention.

(b) Trump will achieve at least 3% among Manifold respondents if his polling percentage against Joe Biden is 3% or more higher than his polling percentage against a generic Democrat when both polls conclude on July 6. The calculation is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)), and for a YES answer, the difference between the two polls must be >= 0.03.

question.title: Will either Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if any of the following occur: 

(a) Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) The percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first Manifold poll (with Joe Biden on the ballot) exceeds that in the second Manifold poll (with a generic Democrat on the ballot) by 3% or more when both polls close on July 6. The formula used is (Trump / (Trump + the Democrat in the question + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.

not_P.title: Will neither Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election nor Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if none of the following occur: 

(a) Donald Trump Jr. is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is not selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) The percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first Manifold poll (with Joe Biden on the ballot) does not exceed that in the second Manifold poll (with a generic Democrat on the ballot) by 3% or more when both polls close on July 6. The formula used is (Trump / (Trump + the Democrat in the question + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Donald Trump Jr. to become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or for Trump to receive at least a 3% increase in support among Manifold respondents when compared to Joe Biden versus a generic Democrat?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if any of the following conditions are met: 

(a) Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, based solely on the decision made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) The vote percentage for Donald Trump in the initial Manifold poll (with Joe Biden listed) surpasses that of the subsequent Manifold poll (with a generic Democrat listed) by 3% or more when both polls conclude on July 6. The calculation used is (Trump / (Trump + the Democrat in the question + Someone else)). The response is YES if the result of this calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot for any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention is validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled as of July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may arise *after* the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and subsequently reinstated, such that as of July 15 he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title:
Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)	
 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

not_P.title: Will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) not be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?

para_P.title: Will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) show an increase compared to the previous year on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude based on the data provided by the St. Louis Fed at the following link: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The figure reported for July 20, 2024 must exceed the figure reported on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be marked as **No**. This inquiry may take into account any new candidates that may emerge in the future.

For the purposes of this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, and (2) Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(1) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) reported by the St. Louis Fed on July 20, 2024, is greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023. See: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.

(2) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future. It is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(2) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **Yes** if they are selected instead. This question may consider new candidates added in the future. It is determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(1) This question will be marked as **Yes** if the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) published by the St. Louis Fed on July 20, 2024, exceeds the figure reported on July 20, 2023. Refer to: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.

Any other candidates will be marked as **No**. This question may take into account new candidates that may emerge later. (a) The question about the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will resolve as **Yes** if the reported number on July 20, 2024, is greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023, according to the St. Louis Fed's reporting here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.

not_P.body:
(a) The question about the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will resolve as **Yes** if the reported number on July 20, 2024, is not greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023, according to the St. Louis Fed's reporting here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.

(b) The question about Donald Trump will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.
