para_P.body:
(a) The inquiry regarding the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be deemed **Yes** if the figure reported on July 20, 2024, exceeds the figure reported on July 20, 2023, based on the St. Louis Fed's data available here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.

(b) The inquiry concerning Donald Trump will be resolved as **Yes** if he is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is not pertinent; it is determined solely by the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. Future candidates may also be taken into account.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not die before Saturday?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
This will resolve to YES if an official declaration of Joe Biden's death is made before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. 

If no such announcement occurs, it will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

not_P.title: Will the head of the Secret Service not resign within the next 90 days?
not_P.body: Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, not resign, not be fired, and for no other reason continue to be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

para_P.title: Is it possible that the head of the Secret Service will step down in the upcoming 90 days?
para_P.body: Is there a chance that Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, will resign, be dismissed, or otherwise cease to be the director of the Secret Service prior to October 12, 2024?

question.title: Will both Joe Biden die before Saturday and the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: This question resolves to YES if and only if both of the following conditions are met: (1) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, and (2) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason no longer serves as the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. If either condition is not met, this question resolves to NO.

not_P.title: Will either Joe Biden not die before Saturday or the head of the Secret Service not resign within the next 90 days?
not_P.body: This question resolves to YES if and only if at least one of the following conditions is not met: (1) There is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, or (2) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, does not resign, is not fired, or for any other reason continues to serve as the director of the Secret Service beyond October 12, 2024. If both conditions are met, this question resolves to NO.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden pass away prior to Saturday while the head of the Secret Service steps down within the upcoming 90 days?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES only if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) An official declaration of Joe Biden's passing occurs before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, and (2) Kimberly Cheatle, the Chief of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is dismissed, or for any reason ceases to hold the position of director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. If either criterion is not fulfilled, this inquiry will conclude with a NO.

question.title: Will either Joe Biden die before Saturday or the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden die before Saturday? Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO. 

(b) Will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days? Resolves YES if Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason is no longer the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024.

not_P.title: Will neither Joe Biden die before Saturday nor the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
not_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden not die before Saturday? Resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO. 

(b) Will the head of the Secret Service not resign within the next 90 days? Resolves YES if Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, does not resign, is not fired, or for any other reason is still the director of the Secret Service after October 12, 2024.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday or that the head of the Secret Service will step down in the upcoming 90 days?
para_P.body:
(a) Is it possible for Joe Biden to pass away before Saturday? This will be marked as YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's death prior to market closure at the end of Friday, July 26th. If not, it will be marked as NO. 

(b) Is there a chance that the head of the Secret Service will resign within the next 90 days? This will be marked as YES if Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, gets dismissed, or for any other reason is no longer in her position as director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Ted Cruz is selected as the nominee, this question will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No** resolution. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election; it is determined solely by the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 3 but not surpass 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reflected on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies a lead for Biden. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which equates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election AND Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (2) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. If both conditions are not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election OR Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (1) Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (2) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. If at least one condition is met, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Ted Cruz going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election AND will Trump's margin over Biden be more than 3 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, determined solely by the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (2) Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election exceeds 3 and is at most 4, as shown on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is in front. If either of these criteria is not satisfied, this inquiry will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met:

(a) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions is met:

(a) Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is not greater than 3 and not less than or equal to 4 in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following will happen: (a) Ted Cruz becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 3 but not exceeding 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if at least one of the following situations occurs:

(a) Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is based on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), rather than the individual who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates that Biden is ahead.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

not_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden publicly declare his refusal of the Democratic nomination for President before July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden publicly declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for President?

This resolves in the same manner as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be marked as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not pursue or accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election.

For a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it must eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement does not occur before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be marked as No.

Additional details and fine print can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question is resolved, its outcome will automatically apply to this market. Users with a reasonable level of trust are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. You can also contact @jskf for requests for early resolution or to report any issues.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Will there be no Democratic party presidential debate?
not_P.body: Resolves YES if there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is another presidential debate for the Democratic party expected?
para_P.body: Resolves YES if a debate takes place among prospective Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO in all other cases.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) there is another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? Resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If such a statement is not made before the deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate? Resolves Yes if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves No otherwise.

not_P.title: Will not both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) there is no other Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention?
not_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? Resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If such a statement is made before the deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Will there be no other Democratic party presidential debate? Resolves Yes if there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves No otherwise.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Joe Biden makes an announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) there will be another presidential debate for the Democratic party prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for President? This resolves as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and public statement indicating that he will not pursue and will not accept his party's nomination for another term as President in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be straightforward and definitive, allowing no possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If such a declaration is not made by the deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Will there be an additional debate for the Democratic party's presidential candidates? This resolves as Yes if there is a debate among potential Democratic contenders (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It resolves as No otherwise.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) there is another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this resolves as No.

(b) Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate? This resolves as Yes if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves No otherwise.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, nor (b) there is no other Democratic party presidential debate?
not_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving room for the possibility that Biden might accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this resolves as No.

(b) Will there be no other Democratic party presidential debate? This resolves as Yes if there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves No otherwise.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Joe Biden declares before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) there is an additional Democratic party presidential debate?
para_P.body:
(a) Is Joe Biden going to declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his team makes a clear, public, official statement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, leaving no doubt that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this will be considered No.

(b) Will there be another debate among Democratic party presidential candidates? This will be considered Yes if there is a debate involving potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be No otherwise.

question.title: Will Google DeepMind publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

not_P.title: Will Google DeepMind not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
not_P.body: For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they do not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it expected that Google DeepMind will release a report detailing findings from an external red-team evaluation of their models for safety before June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, prior to June 30, 2024, they issue a *public* report that includes the findings from an *external* entity assessing the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT not be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
not_P.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If available in certain EU countries, or available to (for example) minors, this will still resolve negatively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves negatively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially different (not entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will ChatGPT from OpenAI be available to users in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) can be accessed by users in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it cannot.

The term "available to users" implies that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can utilize it without needing a VPN (which may involve a fee). If it is not accessible in specific EU nations (similar to the situation in Italy in early 2023), or if it is restricted for certain groups (like minors), it will still be considered a positive resolution, provided that more than 50% of the population has access.

Here, "ChatGPT" refers to the standard web platform (excluding the API) used for engaging with GPT models. It will still be seen as a positive resolution if the branding or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (submitting queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will both of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) Google DeepMind publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union?
question.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) Google DeepMind does not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is not generally available in the European Union?
not_P.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they do not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If available in certain EU countries, or available to (for example) minors, this will still resolve negatively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves negatively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Is it expected that by June 30, 2024, both of the following will happen: (a) Google DeepMind releases a report detailing the findings from an external evaluation of their models for safety, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the European Union?
para_P.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this question will be answered with **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they issue a *public* report containing the findings from an *external* party assessing the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) The inquiry will be resolved as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is broadly accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

Here, "broadly accessible" indicates that the standard condition for individuals in the EU is that they can reach it without using a VPN (potentially requiring payment). If it is not accessible in certain EU nations (similar to the situation in Italy in early 2023), or not available to (for instance) minors, this will still resolve positively, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

"ChatGPT" in this context refers to the general web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still resolve positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will either of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) Google DeepMind publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety, or (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union?
question.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, the question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries, or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) Google DeepMind publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety, nor (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union?
not_P.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they do not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, the question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries, or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: By June 30, 2024, will one of the following happen: (a) a report detailing the outcomes of external safety evaluations of Google DeepMind's models is released, or (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the European Union?
para_P.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this inquiry will be answered with **YES** if they issue a *public* report by June 30, 2024, showing the results from an *independent* evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, the question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is broadly available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

The term "broadly available" indicates that the default situation for individuals in the EU is that they can access it without needing a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is inaccessible in certain EU nations, or to specific groups (like minors), it will still be considered a positive resolution, provided that more than 50% of the population can use it.

The term "ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) used for engaging with GPT models. It will still be considered a positive resolution if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to input queries into systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Malta not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Malta going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they fail to qualify, the resolution will be **No**.

question.title: Will Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If it does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Slovenia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Slovenia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If it qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Slovenia going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Slovenia takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if it fails to qualify, the inquiry will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both Malta and Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Malta and Slovenia participate in a Semi-final and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Malta or Slovenia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will either Malta or Slovenia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Malta or Slovenia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If both Malta and Slovenia qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Malta and Slovenia both set to advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if both Malta and Slovenia take part in a Semi-final and are officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Malta or Slovenia fails to qualify, the inquiry will be considered **No**.

question.title: Will either Malta or Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Malta or Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Malta nor Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither Malta nor Slovenia participates in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Malta or Slovenia going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if either Malta or Slovenia competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither of them qualifies, the response will be **No**.

question.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

not_P.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court not issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) does not issue a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Will the International Criminal Court make any arrests of the specified Israeli officials before July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the Israeli cabinet members listed below prior to July 1, 2024. It will be marked as **No** in all other cases.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

not_P.title: Will a terrorist act not occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
not_P.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if no terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above happens.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of a terrorist incident happening in metropolitan France during the Summer Olympics of 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a Yes if a terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injuries and/or fatalities of at least one individual, excluding the perpetrator(s), between the dates of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). Conversely, the answer will be No if the aforementioned scenario does not occur.

An incident will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any official entity of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Before July 1, 2024, the ICC issues arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders; (2) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members:
   * Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
   * Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
   * Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

2. A terrorist attack occurs in Metropolitan France that injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024) of the 2024 Summer Olympics. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

The question will resolve as **No** if one or both of the above conditions are not met.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) Before July 1, 2024, the ICC issues arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders; (2) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met:

1. Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) does not issue a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members:
   * Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
   * Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
   * Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

2. A terrorist attack does not occur in Metropolitan France that injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024) of the 2024 Summer Olympics. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is not described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

The question will resolve as **No** if one or both of the above conditions are met.

* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

(b) A terrorist act occurs in Metropolitan France that results in injuries and/or fatalities to at least one individual, other than the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be classified as a 'terrorist act' if it is labeled as such by any official French agency, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Cabinet.

The question will be answered with **No** if neither of the aforementioned events occurs.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would represent a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as YES if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. question.title: Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

not_P.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the underdog on Friday?
not_P.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Joe Biden's chances of winning the US presidential election exceed those of Donald Trump based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will resolve to "No" if Donald Trump is projected to have a greater likelihood of winning than Joe Biden according to the same forecast for that date. In the event that both candidates are shown to have equal probabilities, the market will resolve at 50-50.

The resolution will rely on the FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines on the date of resolution. Any changes in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to derive its estimates will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will be resolved based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. It may not resolve until the July 20 data is available. If there are no data points for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve based on the closest prior figures to July 19.

Please be aware that the resolution pertains to the winning odds for each candidate expressed as a percentage out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (for example, "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and will FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024.

For condition (a), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For condition (b), the resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50. This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

not_P.title: Will Tim Scott not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will FiveThirtyEight not project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) Tim Scott is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Joe Biden does not have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024.

For condition (a), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For condition (b), the resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50. This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

para_P.title: Is Tim Scott going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (a) Tim Scott is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Joe Biden has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the date of July 19, 2024.

For criterion (a), it does not matter who is nominated by the Republicans on the day of the 2024 US election; the decision is solely based on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For criterion (b), the resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024. Adjustments in the methods used by FiveThirtyEight to calculate its figures will not affect the resolution of this market. If Biden and Trump have identical probabilities, this market will resolve 50-50. This market will conclude based on the data points for July 19 as soon as data points for July 20 are released. If no data points for July 19 are accessible by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the closest available figures prior to July 19.

question.title: Will either Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date.

not_P.title: Will neither Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election nor will FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50. para_P.title: Is it possible that either Tim Scott becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or that FiveThirtyEight indicates Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (a) Tim Scott is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If both Biden and Trump have the same probability, this market will resolve with a 50-50 outcome. The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the data represented by the blue and red trend lines for the resolution date of this market.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not testify at the hush money trial?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has not testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump provide testimony during the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will Greens–EFA not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA group secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:

In the event that two groups have an equal number of seats, both sub-questions will be deemed **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will rely on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable news sources.
