question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

not_P.title: Will an athlete not win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if no athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

para_P.title: Is it possible for an athlete to secure multiple medals in tennis during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry concludes as **Yes** if any athlete achieves a minimum of two medals in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g. neither team playing the final of the last event has won any of the others).

not_P.title: Will the same nation not win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if women's teams representing fewer than eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must not have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **No**.

The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g. at least one team playing the final of the last event has won one of the others).

para_P.title: Will a single country secure victories in multiple women's team sports during the 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **No** if teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) achieve gold in the following eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Conversely, the same NOC must have triumphed in at least two of these competitions for the answer to be **Yes**.

The resolution of this question can occur as soon as it is evident that one of these scenarios will take place (for instance, if neither of the teams competing in the final of the last event has claimed victory in any of the previous events).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics (b) The same nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

(b) This question resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**. The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g. neither team playing the final of the last event has won any of the others).

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur: (a) An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics (b) The same nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
(a) This question resolves as **Yes** if no athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

(b) This question resolves as **Yes** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, the same NOC must not have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **No**. The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will not happen (e.g. at least one team playing the final of the last event has won one of the others).

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) A player secures multiple medals in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics (b) The same country achieves victory in more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will be answered with **Yes** if any player earns at least two medals in tennis during the 2024 Paris Olympics.

(b) This question will be answered with **No** if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. If not, then the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, leading to a **Yes** resolution for the question. The question can be resolved as soon as it is evident that one of these scenarios will occur (for example, if neither team in the final of the last event has won any of the others).

question.title: Will either of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) Any athlete wins more than one medal for tennis (b) The same nation wins more than one women's team sport?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met: 

(a) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

(b) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the following women's team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. This condition resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different NOCs win gold in these eight team sports. The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g., neither team playing the final of the last event has won any of the others).

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) Any athlete wins more than one medal for tennis (b) The same nation wins more than one women's team sport?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions is met: 

(a) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

(b) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the following women's team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. This condition resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different NOCs win gold in these eight team sports.

para_P.title: Is it possible for one of the following to take place during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) Any tennis player secures more than one medal (b) A single country claims victory in more than one women's team sport?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the subsequent scenarios occurs: 

(a) Any tennis player achieves at least two medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

(b) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) obtains gold in more than one of these women's team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. This scenario will be answered with **No** if women's teams from eight distinct NOCs win gold in these eight team sports. The question can be resolved as soon as it is evident that one of these scenarios will occur (for instance, if neither team competing in the final event has won any of the others).

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will Biden not drop out before July 20?
not_P.body: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden decide to withdraw or become incapable of continuing his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

The resolution of this question requires both (a) and (b) to be true.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but not exceeding 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

If both conditions are not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA be the leading party in terms of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 elections for the European Parliament, and it will be considered **No** for any alternative results. In the event of a tie between two groups for the number of seats, both sub-questions will be resolved as **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will rely on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable news sources.

(2) The Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, as determined by [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports. If both conditions are satisfied, the question resolves to **Yes**; otherwise, it resolves to **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but at most 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would count as a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

2. Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

If either of these conditions is not met, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, nor (b) Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

2. Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

If both of these conditions are met, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden will exceed 2 but not surpass 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Tim Scott will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied:

1. Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is more than 2 and at most 3 on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead.

2. Tim Scott is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is based solely on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), rather than who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

If either of these criteria is not fulfilled, the inquiry will conclude as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on the date of July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is not greater than 2 or greater than 3 on the date of July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tim Scott is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden exceeds 2 but does not go beyond 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average? (b) Tim Scott becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is more than 2 and at most 3 on July 15, 2024, according to the chart when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a Trump lead.

(b) This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Tim Scott is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; it is solely based on who is elected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and do not cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker does not ask Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Biden be recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
Determined to be YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other appropriate authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not apply. Biden's invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will neither seek nor accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 and (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 nor (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will happen: (a) Biden is declared unfit under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024 and (b) Joe Biden publicly states before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) Resolves to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this question. Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc. is not included. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded. Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

(b) This question will be answered as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official announcement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. For a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unequivocal and definitive: it should not allow for any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur before mid-July 2024: (a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 (b) Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This requires the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President. The duration of the incapacity does not matter. Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not count.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of accepting the nomination.

If either condition (a) or (b) is met, this question resolves as **Yes**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur before mid-July 2024: (a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 (b) Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs:

(a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This requires the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President. The duration of the incapacity does not matter. Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not count.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of accepting the nomination.

If neither condition (a) nor (b) is met, this question resolves as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens prior to mid-July 2024: (a) Biden is declared unable to perform his duties under the 25th Amendment Section 4 (b) Biden states he will not pursue the Democratic nomination?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place:

(a) Biden is declared unable to perform his duties under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This necessitates a formal declaration from the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," which would lead the Vice President to act as President. The length of the incapacity is irrelevant. Biden leaving office due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not seek nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election. The announcement must be clear and definitive, with no ambiguity regarding the acceptance of the nomination.

If either condition (a) or (b) occurs, this question will be answered as **Yes**.

question.title: Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).  If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) not form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, no electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If such an agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Les Républicains collaborate with the National Rally for the 2024 elections in France?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if an official announcement regarding an electoral coalition or alliance between Les Républicains and the National Rally is made before June 30, 2024, based on [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If no such coalition or agreement is declared, the resolution will be **No**.

question.title: Will the Prime Minister of France belong to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

not_P.title: Will the Prime Minister of France not belong to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: Will the French Prime Minister be a member of the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the French Prime Minister's party is Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, based on reliable sources.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) forms a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election and (b) The Prime Minister of France belongs to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
question.body: (a) This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**. question.title: Will either of the following occur by mid-2024 in France: (a) An electoral alliance between Les Républicains and National Rally, or (b) The Prime Minister belongs to the Together coalition?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met:

(a) Before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

para_P.title: By mid-2024 in France, will one of the following take place: (a) A coalition formed between Les Républicains and National Rally, or (b) The Prime Minister is a member of the Together coalition?

question.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Francis Suarez not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Francis Suarez be the chosen candidate for the Republican Party in the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is appointed by the Republican National Convention as their candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be marked as **No**. This question is not limited to the individuals currently being discussed; additional candidates may emerge later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; it is strictly based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will the Democratic Party hold a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if a single ballot suffices, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

For part (a), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For part (b), if only one ballot is required, then this part resolves as **No**. The question resolves as **Yes** only if both conditions are met.

not_P.title: Will Francis Suarez not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Francis Suarez is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

For part (a), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For part (b), if only one ballot is required, then this part resolves as **Yes**. The question resolves as **Yes** if either condition is met.

para_P.body:

para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if at least one of these scenarios occurs: (a) Francis Suarez is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. (b) The Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is necessary, then this scenario will be deemed **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be 3 or less or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 3 but not surpass 4, based on the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the difference between Donald Trump and Joe Biden in the national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as recorded by 538 on July 15, 2024, and checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this query.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

not_P.title: Will the same nation not win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as Yes if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must not have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a single country to secure victories in multiple women's team sports during the 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with No if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) achieve gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

Conversely, for the answer to be Yes, the same NOC must have claimed victory in at least two of these competitions.

This question resolves as Yes if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as No.

para_P.title: Will one of the following happen: (a) A Woman be the Democratic Presidential Nominee in 2024 (b) The same country secure victories in multiple women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
(a) Will a Woman be the Democratic Presidential Nominee for the 2024 election? This will be answered with “yes” if the Democratic delegates choose a female candidate for the presidential nomination in 2024. It will be answered with “no” if the Democratic delegates opt for a male candidate for the presidential nomination in 2024.

(b) Will a single country achieve more than one victory in women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics? This question will be answered with “no” if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold medals in the eight team sports—association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Conversely, if the same NOC wins at least two of these events, the question will be answered with “yes.”

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

not_P.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is ≤46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: Do Kamala's chances of victory improve in the upcoming week based on Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the Electoral College likelihood for Harris in Nate Silver's analysis exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. It will be deemed a NO in all other cases.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public declaration before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign delivers a clear, public, official statement confirming that Joe Biden will not pursue nor accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

To achieve a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be unmistakable and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden might accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not issued prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is <=46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(b) This question will resolve as **No** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **No** resolution, the statement must be ambiguous or inconclusive: it should leave room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Nate Silver's model indicates that Kamala's chances of winning will rise in the upcoming week, and (b) Joe Biden will publicly confirm before July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if the probability of Harris in the Electoral College according to Nate Silver's model is greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. It will be marked as NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(b) This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear and official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not pursue or accept the Democratic nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be explicit and definitive: it must eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will either Kamala's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model or Joe Biden announce not accepting the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) The Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. (b) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a YES resolution for (b), the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If neither condition (a) nor (b) is met, this question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither Kamala's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model nor Joe Biden announce accepting the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if neither of the following occurs: (a) The Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. (b) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will seek or will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a YES resolution for (b), the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If either condition (a) or (b) is met, this question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that Kamala's likelihood of winning will rise based on Nate Silver's analysis, or will Joe Biden declare that he won't accept the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will result in a YES if at least one of the following happens: (a) The probability of Harris winning in Nate Silver's analysis exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. (b) Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, and official statement that he will not pursue and will not accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. For condition (b) to qualify for a YES resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive, leaving no ambiguity regarding Biden's acceptance of the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election. If neither condition (a) nor (b) occurs, this question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic lawmakers in the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the proposal to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating efforts to voice their opposition to their party's initiative to expedite President Joe Biden’s nomination, which they claim suppresses the vital ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker participating in the initiative.

A letter, drafted and circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, represents the first public indication from Democrats following the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their members are significantly concerned about the trajectory of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart strategy to cut off debate and, by sheer force, create unity, but that approach is ineffective,” Huffman stated in an interview. He did not confirm whether the letter exists.

This market will be resolved as YES if a public statement opposing the early nomination proposal is signed by at least 20 members of the House or Senators who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Additionally, multiple letters totaling 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market as YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, this market will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is a brokered convention expected for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple voting rounds during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if only a single ballot is needed, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early (b) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
(a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early:

Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

(b) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024:

This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early (b) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats do not sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early:

Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if no public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are met by market close, this market resolves NO.

(b) Democrats do not have a brokered convention in 2024:

This question resolves as **No** if the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) A minimum of 20 Democrats in the House or Senate will endorse a public letter against the early nomination of Biden, and (b) there will be a brokered convention for Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) A minimum of 20 Democrats in the House or Senate will endorse a public letter against the early nomination of Biden:

Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party's initiative to finalize President Joe Biden's nomination sooner than initially planned, arguing that it suppresses the critical ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, based on insights from a participating lawmaker.

A drafted letter, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, represents the first public indication from Democrats following the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their members are significantly concerned about Biden's candidacy.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to stifle debate and somehow achieve unity through sheer force, but that’s not how it works,” Huffman stated in an interview. He did not confirm whether the letter exists.

This market will conclude with a YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 members of the House or Senators aligned with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' endorsements would also suffice for this market to conclude with a YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market's closing time, it will conclude with a NO.

(b) There will be a brokered convention for Democrats in 2024:

This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Democratic Party necessitates more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is needed, then this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, or will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
(a) At least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. This includes the possibility of multiple letters with a combined total of at least 20 signatures.

(b) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

not_P.title: Will neither at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, nor will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) No House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. This includes the impossibility of multiple letters with a combined total of at least 20 signatures.

(b) The Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic lawmakers publicly oppose the plan to nominate Biden early, or will the Democrats need a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) A minimum of 20 members from the House or Senate who align with the Democratic Party publicly oppose the early nomination strategy by signing a letter before the market closes on Sunday, July 21st. This may include several letters that together gather at least 20 signatures.

(b) The Democratic Party necessitates more than one voting round in its roll call to officially nominate its candidate for the US presidential election in 2024.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not be president by the end of July?
not_P.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is not officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: Is Joe Biden expected to remain president until the end of July?
para_P.body: This market will conclude with a yes if Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.
