question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024 and will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body: This question resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, and (b) a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before the end of Sunday, July 21st, 2024. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also meet this criterion.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not be president by the end of July 2024 or will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body: This question resolves YES if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) Joe Biden is not officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, or (b) a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before the end of Sunday, July 21st, 2024. No such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also meet this criterion.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden remain in office as president until the conclusion of July 2024, and will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the initiative to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as YES if both of the subsequent conditions are satisfied: (a) Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024, and (b) a public letter opposing the early nomination initiative is signed by no fewer than 20 Democratic House Members or Senators before the end of Sunday, July 21, 2024. Additionally, multiple letters totaling at least 20 signatures from lawmakers would also fulfill this requirement.

question.title: Will either Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024 or at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan?
question.body: This question resolves to YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. (b) A public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st, 2024. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES.

not_P.title: Will neither Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024 nor at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan?
not_P.body: This question resolves to YES if neither of the following occurs: (a) Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. (b) A public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st, 2024. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also not be sufficient to resolve this market to YES.

para_P.title: By the close of July 2024, will Joe Biden remain in office as president, or will a minimum of 20 Democratic House or Senate members endorse a public letter against the early nomination proposal?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if either of the following conditions is met: (a) Joe Biden continues to hold the position of president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024. (b) Before the market closes on Sunday, July 21, 2024, at least 20 members from the House or Senate who align with the Democratic Party have signed a public letter opposing the early nomination strategy for Biden. It is also acceptable for multiple letters to collectively have 20 signatures from lawmakers to result in a YES for this market.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and do not cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland not to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Biden be officially recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate entity) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office" and allows the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, or similar circumstances does not apply. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Background: A GOP legislator has requested Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

In the event that both candidates have equal probabilities, the market will settle at 50-50.

The source for resolution will be the FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the values shown by the blue and red trend lines for the date of resolution. It is important to note that the resolution will refer to each candidate's winning odds expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (e.g., “Trump 57 times out of 100”). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.body:

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican party on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Democrats will need a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party necessitates multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if just a single ballot suffices, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

This market will resolve YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st.

If just one ballot is necessary, then the answer will be **No**.

(2) A minimum of 20 House/Senate Democrats endorse a public letter against the plan to virtually nominate Biden ahead of time: This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who are part of the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Several such letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024, or (b) at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

(b) Context from Politico: Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort. A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy. “It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter. This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024, nor (b) at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body:
(a) This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

(b) Context from Politico: Dozens of House Democrats are not organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue does not stifle the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort. A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, does not offer the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy. “It’s a really good move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it works that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He confirmed the existence of a letter. This market resolves YES if no public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to NO. If these criteria are met by market close, this market resolves YES.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following will take place: (a) the Democrats will have a contested convention in 2024, or (b) a minimum of 20 Democratic Representatives or Senators will publicly oppose the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the Democratic Party necessitates multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if only a single ballot is needed, the outcome will be **No**.

(b) Context from Politico: Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to express opposition to their party's attempt to expedite President Joe Biden’s nomination, which they believe suppresses the vital ongoing discussions regarding his candidacy, as stated by a participating lawmaker. A letter drafted by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO serves as the first public indication from Democrats since the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their members are significantly concerned about Biden’s candidacy. “It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Someone thinks it’s a clever way to stifle debate and I suppose by sheer force, achieve unity, but that’s not how it works,” Huffman remarked in an interview. He refrained from confirming the letter's existence. This market will conclude YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination initiative is endorsed by at least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Several such letters totaling 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. If these conditions are not fulfilled by market closure, the market will resolve NO.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he achieve at least a 3% increase among Manifold voters?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to vote alongside Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to support a typical Democrat in the same scenario.

Public sentiment surveys frequently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump by a margin greater than the error rate, whereas other Democrats surveyed tend to lead or fall within the error margin. Are the Manifold participants reflective of the broader electorate?

This market will conclude with a YES if Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time of closing.

The calculation for Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Others)). A YES answer is reached if the calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer will be NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never resolve as N/A, and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not testify at the hush money trial?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has not testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump provide testimony at the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has provided testimony, either in person or virtually, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) regarding the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Iran military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

not_P.title: Iran military response not before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
not_P.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran does not initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Will Iran take military action before midnight Eastern Time on August 13th?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Iran carries out a military operation on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones from July 30 to August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. If not, the market will end with a "No".

In this context, a "military operation" refers to any act of force executed by Iran against Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones (for example, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons depot located on Israeli soil, this market will resolve to "Yes") and must be officially recognized by the Iranian government or supported by a consensus of reliable reports. This encompasses, but is not limited to, aerial bombardments, naval strikes, or land invasions. Cyber operations, sanctions, or diplomatic measures will not be factored into the resolution of this market.

Only actions taken by Iranian forces that are explicitly acknowledged by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or verified to have originated from Iranian land, will contribute to the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel conducted by proxy groups (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be included in the resolution of this market.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial and (2) Iran initiates a military action on Israeli territory before August 13, 2024?
question.body:
(1) This question will resolve as **Yes** if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

(2) This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market. Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial nor (2) Iran initiates a military action on Israeli territory before August 13, 2024?
not_P.body:
(1) This question will resolve as **Yes** if no credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

(2) This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran does not initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force not executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory that is not officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market. Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will not count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (1) Donald Trump provides testimony at the hush money trial and (2) Iran launches a military operation against Israeli land prior to August 13, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, regardless of whether it was in person or via remote means, at the trial related to the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

(2) This market will determine a "Yes" resolution if Iran conducts a military operation on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime regions between July 30 and August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. For the context of this market, a "military operation" refers to any act of force carried out by Iran on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime regions that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or supported by a consensus of credible reports. This includes, but is not limited to, aerial assaults, naval strikes, or ground invasions. Cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic maneuvers will not be considered for the resolution of this market. Only actions taken by Iranian forces that are explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory, will be counted towards the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy groups (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be included in the resolution of this market.

question.title: Will either Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial or Iran initiate a military action on Israeli territory before August 13, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. (b) Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, and this action is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. The military action includes any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory, such as airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count. Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces will not count.

not_P.title: Will neither Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial nor Iran initiate a military action on Israeli territory before August 13, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. (b) Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, and this action is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. The military action includes any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory, such as airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count. Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces will not count.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump take the stand in the hush money trial or will Iran launch a military operation on Israeli land before August 13, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following happens: (a) Reliable sources confirm that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or remotely, at the trial related to the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. (b) Iran commences a military operation on Israeli territory, including airspace or maritime zones, between July 30 and August 12, 2024, by 11:59 PM ET, and this operation is officially recognized by the Iranian authorities or corroborated by a consensus of trustworthy reporting. The military operation encompasses any use of force carried out by Iran on Israeli land, airspace, or maritime territory, such as airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground incursions. Cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic measures will not be considered. Only actions by Iranian military forces that are explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian soil, will be counted. Attacks on Israel by proxy groups will not be included.

question.title: Will Albania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will resolve as **No** for all other outcomes regarding Albania.

not_P.title: Will Albania not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Albania does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will resolve as **No** for all other outcomes regarding Albania.

para_P.title: Is Albania going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Albania takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. It will resolve as **No** for any other scenarios concerning Albania.

question.title: Will Iceland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Iceland not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Iceland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If so, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Iceland set to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Iceland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Otherwise, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will both Albania and Iceland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will resolve as **No** if either or both countries do not qualify.

not_P.title: Will either Albania or Iceland not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Albania does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Iceland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will resolve as **No** if both countries qualify.

para_P.title: Are both Albania and Iceland going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be 2 or less or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in favor of Trump over Biden be more than 2 but at most 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is a brokered convention expected for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if a single ballot suffices, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (2) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
(1) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This is based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

(2) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this condition is not met.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, nor (2) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body:
(1) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This is based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

(2) The Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this condition is met.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (1) Trump's margin over Biden will exceed 2 but not surpass 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (2) the Democrats will experience a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) On July 15, 2024, Trump's margin over Biden is projected to be more than 2 and at most 4, based on 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election. This projection is derived from Donald Trump's standing relative to Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for that date, as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates Trump's advantage.

(2) The Democratic Party will need to conduct multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If the nomination can be achieved in a single ballot, then this condition does not hold.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. (b) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, which would indicate a brokered convention. If only one ballot is required, this part resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 4 points on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. (b) The Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, which would indicate that there is no brokered convention. If only one ballot is required, this part resolves as **Yes**.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will either of the following happen: (a) Trump have a lead over Biden that exceeds 2 but does not go beyond 4 according to 538's national polling average? (b) Will the Democrats face a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be resolved as **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (a) The national polling average from 538 indicates that Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in the 2024 presidential election exceeds 2 and is 4 or lower on July 15, 2024, as shown on the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates Biden is ahead. (b) The Democratic Party needs to conduct more than one voting round in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, signifying a brokered convention. If only a single ballot is needed, this aspect will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

not_P.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the underdog on Friday?
not_P.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will 538 indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, this market will conclude with “No” if Donald Trump is determined to have a better chance of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. In the event that Biden and Trump are seen as having equal chances, this market will resolve at 50-50.

The resolution will be based on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, particularly the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines for the resolution date of this market. Any changes in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to calculate its data will not affect the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as data for July 20 is released. It may not reach a conclusion until the data for July 20 is available. If no data for July 19 is present by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve using the closest preceding figures to July 19.

Please be aware that the resolution pertains to the winning odds for each candidate expressed as a number out of 100 reported to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be taken into account.

The source for this determination will be the FiveThirtyEight 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the values shown by the blue and red trend lines for July 19. If there are no available data points for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the resolution will rely on the closest previous data available.

(b) This will be classified as "Yes" if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is more than 2 and less than or equal to 4 in the national polling average reported by 538 for the 2024 presidential election as presented on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates that Biden is ahead. For instance, a reported figure of 2.4 would suggest Trump is leading Biden by 2.4 points.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Finland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Finland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Finland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Finland not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Finland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Finland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Finland set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Finland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Finland fails to qualify, the inquiry will conclude with a **No**.

(b) Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Norway competes in a Semi-final and is officially acknowledged by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. question.title: Will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will the ID political group not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **No**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the ID political faction secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the ID political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will conclude as **No** for any other political factions. In the event that two factions are tied in seat count, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This inquiry resolves based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

question.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

not_P.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement not be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is not approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

para_P.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement receive approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Pandemic Agreement is sanctioned through a vote during the World Health Assembly (WHA) in May 2024, based on information from reliable sources.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, and (b) The Pandemic Agreement is approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This is based on [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports. If two groups are tied for seats, this condition is considered met.

2. The Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), according to reports from credible sources.

If either condition is not met, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, nor (b) The Pandemic Agreement is approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met:

1. The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This is based on [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports. If two groups are tied for seats, this condition is considered not met.

2. The Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), according to reports from credible sources.

If either condition is met, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will the following two events take place: (a) The ID political faction secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, and (b) The Pandemic Agreement receives approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if both of the subsequent requirements are satisfied:

1. The ID political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This determination is based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or trustworthy media coverage. In the event of a tie between two factions for seats, this requirement will still be considered fulfilled.

2. The Pandemic Agreement is ratified through a vote during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), as reported by reliable sources.

Should either requirement not be fulfilled, the inquiry will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by mid-2024: (a) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, or (b) The Pandemic Agreement is approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body:
(a) The question regarding the ID political group will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

(b) The question regarding the Pandemic Agreement will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by mid-2024: (a) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, nor (b) The Pandemic Agreement is approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
not_P.body:
(a) The question regarding the ID political group will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **No**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

(b) The question regarding the Pandemic Agreement will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is not approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

para_P.title: By mid-2024, will one of the following happen: (a) The ID political faction secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, or (b) The Pandemic Agreement receives approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) The inquiry about the ID political faction will be considered **Yes** if the ID political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will be marked as **No** for all other factions. In the event that two factions are equally represented in terms of seats, both sub-questions will be marked as **Yes**. This inquiry will be resolved based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media coverage.

(b) The inquiry concerning the Pandemic Agreement will be marked as **Yes** if the Pandemic Agreement is ratified during a vote at the World Health Assembly (WHA) in May 2024, based on reports from trustworthy sources.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Will Hurd not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Will Hurd going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a resolution of **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates listed currently; additional options may be introduced later.

For the purposes of this question, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is solely based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.body:
(a) Will Hurd will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) Joe Biden will announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President: This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

not_P.body:
(a) Will Hurd not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) Joe Biden will announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President: This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. para_P.title: Are both of the following events going to take place: (a) Will Hurd be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? (b) Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Hurd be selected as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election: This question will be answered with **Yes** if Will Hurd is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be answered with **No**. This question is open to candidates not listed currently; additional options may emerge later. For this query, it does not matter who is the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election; it is only based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) Joe Biden will announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President: This will be answered with Yes if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement that Joe Biden will not seek or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. For a Yes resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a clear statement is not made by 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be answered as No.

question.title: Will either Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For part (a), the resolution is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

For part (b), to qualify for a Yes resolution, Joe Biden's statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that he would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made prior to the deadline, this part will resolve as No.

not_P.title: Will neither Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election nor Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, nor (b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For part (a), the resolution is determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

For part (b), to qualify for a Yes resolution, Joe Biden's statement must be ambiguous and inconclusive, leaving room for the possibility that he would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is made prior to the deadline, this part will resolve as No.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either Will Hurd becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or that Joe Biden publicly declares before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not seek nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election cycle.

For part (a), the outcome is based on who the delegates of the Republican National Convention decide upon, irrespective of who is nominated on the day of the 2024 US election.

For part (b), for a Yes outcome, Joe Biden's announcement must be clear and definitive, allowing no possibility that he would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If such a declaration is not made before the specified deadline, this part will be resolved as No.
