question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Meta publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, and (b) the linked market gets at least 377 traders by the end of July 15, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Meta must publish a public report by June 30, 2024, with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) The linked market must have at least 377 traders before market close on July 15, 2024, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. Resolves YES if both conditions are met, NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Meta does not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, nor (b) the linked market has fewer than 377 traders by the end of July 15, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Meta must not publish a public report by June 30, 2024, with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) The linked market must have fewer than 377 traders before market close on July 15, 2024, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. Resolves YES if neither condition is met, NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) by June 30, 2024, Meta will release a report detailing the findings from an external red-team evaluation of their models' safety, and (b) the associated market will have a minimum of 377 traders by the end of July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) By June 30, 2024, Meta is required to issue a public report containing the results from an external assessment of the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) The associated market must achieve a count of at least 377 traders before the market closes on July 15, 2024, at 11:59 PM Pacific Time. The outcome will be YES if both criteria are satisfied, NO if not.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by their respective deadlines: (a) Meta publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, or (b) The linked market gets at least 377 traders by end of July 15, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) Resolves YES if the market embedded at https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by their respective deadlines: (a) Meta does not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, nor (b) The linked market gets fewer than 377 traders by end of July 15, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Meta does not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) Resolves YES if the market embedded at https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g has fewer than 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following will happen by the specified deadlines: (a) Meta releases a report detailing the outcomes from external assessments of their models' safety by June 30, 2024, or (b) The associated market achieves a minimum of 377 participants by the end of July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Meta issues a *public* report that includes findings from an *independent* party evaluating the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) It will be marked as YES if the market found at https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g has 377 participants prior to market closure (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will be marked NO otherwise.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

not_P.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain less than 3% among Manifold respondents?
not_P.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by less than 3% when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump faces Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he see an increase of at least 3% among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
There are two polls from Manifold that will close on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to choose a typical Democrat on the same hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion surveys consistently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump outside the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat considered in these hypotheticals either leads or is within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants reflective of the broader public opinion?

This market will be marked as YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer will be YES if the result of this formula for the first poll minus the formula for the second poll is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer will be NO.

These polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A, and will remain active until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will a group of fewer than 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators not pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by not signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group not speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals not be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is sufficient for a NO resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving YES. 

If these criteria are met before July 20th, this market resolves YES.

para_P.title: Will at least five identified Democratic House Representatives or Senators compel Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly requested Biden to withdraw. Two of the most vulnerable Democrats have stated to local media that they believe Biden's chances for victory in November are slim.

Behind the scenes, the activity is even more intense. There are several drafts of letters being shared among House Democrats, and at least one of these would urge Biden to cease his campaign, as reported by five individuals familiar with the discussions.

This market will resolve to YES if a collective of at least five named Democratic Party US House Representatives or US Senators collaborate to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could take the form of signing a letter as mentioned above, or it could occur through a group meeting with Biden, where they collectively request him to withdraw.

It is necessary that all five individuals participate in the same group communication. If five individuals independently express to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw, this will not be enough for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden asking him to step aside will not meet the criteria for this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market closes. In cases where such names are reported but not confirmed with high certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not fulfilled before July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

question.title: Will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden and will a group of at least 5 named Democrats pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
This question resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(b) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter like what is reported, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO.

If both conditions (a) and (b) are satisfied, this question resolves YES. If either condition is not met, this question resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will Trump gain less than 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden or will a group of fewer than 5 named Democrats not pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body:
This question resolves YES if at least one of the following conditions is met:

(a) The percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 does not exceed that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03. 

(b) A group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could mean that either no such group exists or that if a group exists, it does not meet the criteria of having at least five members. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving YES.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Trump to achieve a minimum of 3% support among Manifold participants against Biden, and will a coalition of no fewer than 5 identified Democrats urge Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:

(a) There must be two Manifold polls conducted, both closing on July 6. One poll should inquire Manifold participants to cast their vote alongside Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other should ask participants to vote for a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This market will resolve to YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close. The calculation for determining the vote percentage for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is at least 0.03. If not, the answer will be NO.

(b) A coalition of a minimum of five named Democratic Party members from the US House or US Senate must collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate withdrawing from his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could occur through a signed letter as reported, or through another method such as a group meeting with Biden to collectively ask him to step down. This market requires that all five individuals participate in the same collective message. Merely five individuals separately expressing to the media that they believe Biden should withdraw is insufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden and requesting him to step aside will not meet this market's requirements unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed before the market's deadline. In cases where such names are reported but not confirmed with reasonable certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If both criteria (a) and (b) are fulfilled, the question will resolve to YES. If either criterion is unmet, the question will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat, or (b) a group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
(a) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat: There are two Manifold polls closing on July 6. One asks respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another with a generic Democrat. This will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Trump in the Biden poll exceeds the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more. The formula used is (Trump / (Trump + the Democrat + Someone else)) for each poll, and the difference must be >= 0.03 for a YES resolution.

(b) A group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th: This resolves YES if at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign before July 20th, either by signing a letter or another form of collective request. All five must be part of the same group message. Reports of unnamed Democrats are insufficient unless names are made public before the end date.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Trump does not gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat, nor (b) a group of fewer than 5 named Democratic House Members or Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body:
(a) Trump does not gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat: This resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Trump in the Biden poll does not exceed the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more.

(b) A group of fewer than 5 named Democratic House Members or Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th: This resolves YES if fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign before July 20th.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Trump increases his support by at least 3% among Manifold respondents when compared to Biden rather than a generic Democrat, or (b) a coalition of at least 5 identified Democratic House Members or Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
(a) Trump increases his support by at least 3% among Manifold respondents when compared to Biden rather than a generic Democrat: Two Manifold polls are closing on July 6. One poll asks respondents to select Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while another involves a generic Democrat. This will be marked YES if Trump's vote percentage in the Biden poll surpasses that of the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more. The calculation used is (Trump / (Trump + the Democrat + Someone else)) for each poll, and the difference must be >= 0.03 for a YES outcome.

(b) A coalition of at least 5 identified Democratic House Members or Senators press Biden to withdraw before July 20th: This will be marked YES if at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators collaborate to request Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election campaign prior to July 20th, either through signing a letter or another form of collective appeal. All five must participate in the same group communication. Reports of unnamed Democrats are inadequate unless the names are disclosed publicly before the deadline.

question.title: Will Czechia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Czechia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Czechia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Czechia set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Czechia takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will San Marino qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if San Marino participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Otherwise, it will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will San Marino not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if San Marino does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Otherwise, it will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is San Marino going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if San Marino takes part in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, it will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will both Czechia and San Marino qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) San Marino participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will either Czechia or San Marino not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occur: (a) Czechia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) San Marino does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If both qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Czechia and San Marino both make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the following conditions are met: (a) Czechia takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) San Marino takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the EBU as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both fail to qualify, the response will be **No**.

question.title: Will either Czechia or San Marino qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) San Marino participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Czechia nor San Marino qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Czechia nor San Marino qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) San Marino participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Czechia or San Marino qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will either Czech Republic or San Marino make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Czech Republic competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) San Marino competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Czech Republic nor San Marino advances, the inquiry will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The lack of removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion or barring must be verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be deemed "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may take place after the specified date. It solely focuses on whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the mentioned grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or barred from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded or barred from any ballot as of July 15, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

The question will resolve as NO if either or both of these conditions are not met.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Elon Musk will show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, nor (b) Donald Trump will be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

The question will resolve as NO if either or both of these conditions are met.

para_P.title: Are the following two events going to happen: (a) Elon Musk will attend the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 event, and (b) Donald Trump will be disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the conditions below are fulfilled:

(a) Elon Musk is present as a speaker on the main stage at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, which is one of the major Bitcoin conferences, occurring from July 25 to 27, 2024.

(b) By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This disqualification or barring must be validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The inquiry does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may happen after the specified date. It strictly concerns whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the stated criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and then later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

The inquiry will resolve as NO if either or both of these conditions are not fulfilled.

question.title: Will either Elon Musk appear at Bitcoin Nashville 2024 or Donald Trump be removed from a primary election ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Elon Musk becomes a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024, or (b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. 

For (b), the removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as NO if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will neither Elon Musk appear at Bitcoin Nashville 2024 nor Donald Trump be removed from a primary election ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following occurs: (a) Elon Musk becomes a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024, nor (b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. 

For (b), the removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as NO if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either Elon Musk will be present at Bitcoin Nashville 2024 or Donald Trump will be disqualified from a primary election ballot due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if at least one of the following happens: (a) Elon Musk is featured as a speaker on the main stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, a prominent Bitcoin conference scheduled for July 25-27, 2024, or (b) By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. 

For (b), the disqualification or barring must be substantiated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable news reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The question will be considered negative if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024. Note: This question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may occur after the specified date. It exclusively concerns whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and then later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Maintain Its EU Plurality from Hungary in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

not_P.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Not Maintain Its EU Plurality from Hungary in 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance does not secure more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby not maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Retain Its Majority in the EU from Hungary in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, after the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP coalition obtains a greater number of seats than any other individual party or coalition, thus preserving the largest share of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, based on reliable sources.

question.title: Will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

not_P.title: Will the European Union not announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has not announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.title: Are new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles expected to be announced by the European Union prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if credible sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has declared the imposition of new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Fidesz-KDNP maintains its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024 and (b) the European Union announces new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" only if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources. (b) Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Fidesz-KDNP maintains its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024 nor (b) the European Union announces new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if neither of the following conditions are met: (a) Following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources. (b) Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.title: Is it true that: (a) the Fidesz-KDNP alliance will keep its status as the largest Hungarian party in the EU in 2024, and (b) the EU will declare new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be considered "Yes" only if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (a) After the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP coalition obtains more seats than any other individual party or coalition, thereby preserving the largest representation of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, as reported by reliable sources. (b) Before July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has made an announcement regarding the imposition of new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Fidesz-KDNP maintains its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024 (b) The EU announces new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if either of the following occurs: (a) Following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources. (b) Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Fidesz-KDNP maintains its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024 (b) The EU announces new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if neither of the following occurs: (a) Following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance does not secure more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby failing to maintain the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources. (b) Before July 5, 2024, credible sources do not report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Fidesz-KDNP retains its position as the largest Hungarian party in the EU in 2024 (b) The EU reveals new tariffs on electric vehicles from China prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed "Yes" if at least one of the following takes place: (a) After the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP coalition achieves a greater number of seats than any other individual party or coalition, thus keeping the largest share of Hungarian representation in the European Parliament, as reported by reliable sources. (b) Before July 5, 2024, trustworthy sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has disclosed the implementation of new tariffs or duties affecting the importation of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

question.title: Will Disney announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdon at D23 2024?
question.body: This will resolve YES if Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve NO if it is discussed in a "spitballing ideas" sense similar to the way that some attractions were discussed at the previous D23. It will resolve NO if a Moana ride is announced for a different theme park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. It will be resolved after the convention.

not_P.title: Will Disney not announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024?
not_P.body: This will resolve YES if Disney does not announce a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve NO if it is discussed in a "spitballing ideas" sense similar to the way that some attractions were discussed at the previous D23. It will resolve NO if a Moana ride is announced for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. It will be resolved after the convention.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Disney will reveal a new Moana attraction for Magic Kingdom during D23 2024?
para_P.body: This will be marked as YES if Disney reveals a new Moana-themed attraction for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or prior to the D23 event in August 2024. It will be marked as NO if it is mentioned in a brainstorming context similar to how some attractions were talked about at the last D23. It will also be marked as NO if a Moana attraction is introduced for a different theme park in Florida or another location. Betting concludes on August 8, the day before the event. The outcome will be determined after the event.

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

[image]

It will certainly play at fewer theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses less than or equal to $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is <=$284.5M internationally... this weekend

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will Biden not drop out before July 20?
not_P.body: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden withdraw or become incapable of continuing his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Mike Pence not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Mike Pence is selected as the nominee, this question will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Mike Pence going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Mike Pence is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other contenders will lead to a **No** resolution. This question is open to additional candidates being introduced later on.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who the Republican nominee is on the day of the 2024 US election; the outcome is strictly based on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20 and (b) Mike Pence is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this part will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

(b) This part will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This part is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For part (b), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Biden does not drop out before July 20 nor (b) Mike Pence is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(a) If Biden does not drop out or is otherwise able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this part will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

(b) This part will resolve as **No** if Mike Pence is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **Yes**. This part is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For part (b), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Biden withdraws from the race before July 20 and (b) Mike Pence becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This part will be answered with yes if Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to continue his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20. If not, the answer will be no.

(b) This part will be answered with **Yes** if Mike Pence is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be answered with **No**. Note that this part is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For part (b), it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is based solely on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20 (b) Mike Pence is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: (a) This question will resolve to **Yes** if Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Otherwise, it will resolve to **No**. (b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Biden does not drop out before July 20 (b) Mike Pence is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body: (a) This question will resolve to **Yes** if Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Otherwise, it will resolve to **No**. (b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the following to happen: (a) Biden withdraws from the race before July 20 (b) Mike Pence becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: (a) This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to proceed with the campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20. If not, it will be marked as **No**. (b) This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if Mike Pence is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be marked as **No**. This inquiry is not limited to the candidates currently listed; other candidates may be introduced later. The outcome is determined solely by the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Poland not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Poland set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Poland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Poland fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will both Poland and Denmark qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Denmark participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Poland or Denmark does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

If both Poland and Denmark qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will Greens–EFA not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **No**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA political faction secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and with **No** for all other results. In the event that two factions are tied for seats, both sub-questions will be answered with **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will be based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable news sources.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT not be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
not_P.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Not generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If available in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or available to (for example) minors, this will still resolve negatively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves negatively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be accessible to the general public in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the general public in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Accessible to the general public" means that the standard condition for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (which may involve a payment). If it is not available in specific EU nations (as seen in Italy in early 2023), or if it is restricted for certain groups (like minors), the resolution will still be positive, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

"ChatGPT" pertains to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be considered positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries into systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Greens–EFA holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

(b) The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **No**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

(b) The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If it is available in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or available to (for example) minors, this will still resolve negatively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves negatively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially different (not entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) the Greens–EFA will have the highest number of seats after the European Parliamentary Elections in 2024, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT will be widely accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliament elections, and it will be marked as **No** for any other outcomes. If there is a tie between two groups for the number of seats, both sub-questions will be marked as **Yes**.

The resolution of this question relies on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or trustworthy media sources.

(b) The inquiry will be deemed **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally accessible within the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

Here, "generally accessible" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (potentially requiring payment). If it is not available in certain EU nations (as was observed in Italy in early 2023), or not accessible to specific groups (like minors), it will still be considered a positive resolution, provided that more than 50% of the population can access it.

The term "ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be marked positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to submit queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

para_P.body:
The Rotten Tomatoes page for "Twisters" (2024)

This will be considered a YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or greater, measured one week post-release (July 26th).

Further Information

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

not_P.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" not be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is not higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

para_P.title: Will the initial domestic box office earnings of "Deadpool & Wolverine" surpass the combined total of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine"?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the domestic box office earnings for **Deadpool & Wolverine** as reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) exceed $185,548,391, which is the total of the box office earnings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

The score used will be the integer percentage listed by Rotten Tomatoes. para_P.title: Will the critics' score for "Twisters" (2024) on Rotten Tomatoes reach at least 75%, and will the domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" exceed the combined openings of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine"?
para_P.body: This will be considered YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) The Tomatometer rating for "Twisters" (2024) is 75% or greater, one week post-release (July 26th), as indicated on Rotten Tomatoes. The score referenced will be the whole number percentage shown by Rotten Tomatoes. (2) The domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" as reported by Boxofficemojo on the film's page surpasses $185,548,391, which is the total of the box office openings for "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013), amounting to $132,434,639 and $53,113,752 respectively.

question.title: Will either "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75% or "Deadpool & Wolverine" have a higher domestic box office opening than "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but at most 3 based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as reflected in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the data for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the figure reported was Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would translate to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: On June 28th, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, on June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

not_P.title: On June 28th, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization not be larger than Apple's?
not_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, on June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is not greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

para_P.title: Will Nvidia's market value exceed that of Apple on June 28, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, as of June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization surpasses Apple's, based on data from [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), as verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's on June 28th, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This occurs if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is reported as greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

(b) This occurs if, on June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

not_P.title: Will either of the following not occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or (b) Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's on June 28th, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This does not occur if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is reported as not greater than 2 or greater than 3 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

(b) This does not occur if, on June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is not greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, and (b) Nvidia's market valuation exceed that of Apple's on June 28, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This happens if Donald Trump is shown to have a lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election that is reported as greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump.

(b) This occurs if, on June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is reported to be higher than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's on June 28, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.
