para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will either of the following take place: (a) will Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 2 but be 3 or less based on 538's national polling average? (b) will Nvidia's market valuation surpass Apple's on June 28, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will yield a **Yes** if at least one of the following happens:

(a) According to 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/), Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden that is more than 2 and at most 3 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies Biden is in the lead.

(b) On June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

not_P.title: Will Israel not carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Israel will execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be resolved as **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, reliable reports suggest that an assault linked to Israel and taking place within the territory of Iran has resulted in the deaths of no fewer than five people.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, nor (b) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question resolves **No** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden will be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, and (b) Israel will execute a lethal strike inside Iran before May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) The resolution of this inquiry will depend on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, a reported value of Trump being 2.4 points ahead of Biden translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

(b) This question will be resolved as **Yes** if credible reports emerge, after the publication of this question and before May 1, 2024, confirming that an attack attributed to Israel has occurred within Iran's territory, resulting in the deaths of at least five people.

question.title: Will either Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

2. Credible reports indicate that, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

not_P.title: Will neither Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, nor will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if neither of the following occurs:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

2. Credible reports indicate that, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 in 538's national polling average, or will there be a lethal strike by Israel inside Iran before May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will resolve to **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met:

1. Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election by a margin greater than 2 and up to 3, as recorded on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure suggests Biden is in the lead.

2. Reliable sources report that, after the publication date of this question and prior to May 1, 2024, an incident attributed to Israel resulting in fatalities of at least five people has occurred within the territory of Iran.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Tucker Carlson not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Tucker Carlson is selected, this question will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Tucker Carlson going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other individual being chosen will result in a **No** resolution. This question is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; additional options may be included later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who obtains the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

not_P.title: Will the Republican Party not retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if no credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If an election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Will Ohio's 6th congressional district, formerly represented by Bill Johnson, remain under Republican control in the special election of 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if reliable sources announce that a candidate from the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases where there is conflicting information from popular sources, an official Ohio State source or declaration will be referenced. Should there be no election conducted prior to January 1, 2025, this question will be rendered void.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) the Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
(a) Tucker Carlson must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of the eventual nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) A person representing the Republican Party must win the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. This will be resolved based on credible sources reporting the win, or an Ohio State source or statement if there is disagreement among popular sources. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, this part of the question is annulled.

not_P.title: Will either of the following not occur: (a) Tucker Carlson is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or (b) the Republican Party does not retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
not_P.body:
(a) Tucker Carlson must not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of the eventual nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) A person representing the Republican Party must not win the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. This will be resolved based on credible sources reporting the loss, or an Ohio State source or statement if there is disagreement among popular sources. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, this part of the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Are both of the following events going to take place: (a) Tucker Carlson becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) the Republican Party secures Ohio's 6th congressional district in the special election of 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Tucker Carlson needs to be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This choice is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who the final nominee is on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) A representative of the Republican Party must win the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. This will be determined based on reliable reports of the victory, or an official statement from an Ohio State source if there is a discrepancy among major news outlets. If there is no election conducted before January 1, 2025, this portion of the question is void.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. For (a), any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**, and it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. For (b), if popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used, and if no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, nor (b) the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, nor (b) credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. For (a), if any other candidate is selected, it will resolve as **No**, and it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. For (b), if popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used, and if an election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either (a) Tucker Carlson becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) the Republican Party successfully holds on to Ohio's 6th congressional district in the upcoming special election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following happens: (a) Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) reliable sources indicate that a representative of the Republican Party has emerged victorious in the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. For (a), if any other individual is chosen, the resolution will be **No**, and the identity of the Republican nominee on the date of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; it is strictly based on who is appointed by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. For (b), in cases of conflicting reports from popular sources, an official statement or source from Ohio will be utilized, and if no election takes place before January 1, 2025, the question will be void.

question.title:
Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)	
 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

not_P.title: Will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be lower Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be less than or equal to the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: Is the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) expected to increase compared to the previous year on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body: The resolution of this inquiry will depend on the data published by the St. Louis Fed found at this link: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. For this question to be affirmed, the figure reported on July 20, 2024 must exceed the figure reported on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

not_P.title: Will Israel not carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Israel will execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, reliable reports suggest that an assault linked to Israel has taken place within Iran's territory, resulting in the fatalities of at least five people.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) is higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, and (b) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be considered higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, if the number reported by the St. Louis Fed on July 20, 2024, is greater than that reported on July 20, 2023, as seen here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.
(b) Israel will be considered to have carried out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, if credible reports indicate that, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) is higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, nor (b) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will not be considered higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, if the number reported by the St. Louis Fed on July 20, 2024, is not greater than that reported on July 20, 2023, as seen here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.
(b) Israel will not be considered to have carried out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, if there are no credible reports indicating that, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) On July 20, 2024, the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will show a Year-over-Year increase, and (b) Israel will execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be deemed to have increased Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, if the figure reported by the St. Louis Fed on that date exceeds the figure from July 20, 2023, as demonstrated here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.
(b) Israel will be regarded as having conducted a lethal strike within Iran before May 1, 2024, if reliable reports confirm that, subsequent to the publication of this question and before May 1, 2024, an attack attributed to Israel occurring within Iranian territory has resulted in the deaths of at least five people.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024? (b) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: (a) The question about the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023. (b) The question about Israel carrying out a deadly attack within Iran resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024 nor (b) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body: (a) The question about the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be less than or equal to the reported number on July 20, 2023. (b) The question about Israel carrying out a deadly attack within Iran resolves **No** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it possible for one of the following to happen: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) to be greater Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024? (b) Israel to execute a lethal strike within Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: (a) The resolution concerning the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be determined based on data from the St. Louis Fed found here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Nikki Haley not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Nikki Haley is selected, all other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Nikki Haley going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
The resolution of this question will be **Yes** if Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This inquiry is not limited to the current candidates; additional candidates may be introduced later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; it is strictly based on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not be president by the end of July?
not_P.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is not officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: Is Joe Biden expected to remain in office until the end of July?
para_P.body: This market will conclude with a yes if Joe Biden is still the officially recognized president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Nikki Haley is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Joe Biden is still president by the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) Nikki Haley will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if she is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Joe Biden will still be president by 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, if he is officially holding the office of President of the United States at that time.

not_P.title: Will either of the following not occur: (a) Nikki Haley is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Joe Biden is not still president by the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Nikki Haley will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if she is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Joe Biden will not still be president by 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, if he is not officially holding the office of President of the United States at that time.

para_P.title: Are both of the following events going to take place: (a) Nikki Haley becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Joe Biden remains in office as president by the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Nikki Haley will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election if she is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as their nominee. This selection is made exclusively by the delegates, independent of who is named as the nominee on the date of the 2024 US election.

(b) Joe Biden will continue to be president by 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, if he is officially serving as the President of the United States at that moment.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Nikki Haley is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Joe Biden is still president by the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met: (a) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (b) Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Nikki Haley is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Joe Biden is still president by the end of July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions is met: (a) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (b) Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following will happen: (a) Nikki Haley becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Joe Biden remains in office as president at the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if one of the following scenarios occurs: (a) Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, based solely on the decision of the delegates at the Republican National Convention. (b) Joe Biden is still serving as the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

not_P.title: Will Biden not remain President through end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he remains President through the end of July 2024. 

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a NO resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Is Biden expected to stay in office until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if Biden is still the President of the United States by the end of July 2024 (ET); it will be deemed a NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not result in a YES outcome. (According to the Constitution, an Acting President is not the same as the President.)

question.title: Will Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: Will Ron DeSantis not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is Ron DeSantis going to be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently in contention; additional options may be introduced later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election. The determination is exclusively based on who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden remains President through end of July 2024 and (b) Ron DeSantis is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Biden does not remain President through end of July 2024 nor (b) Ron DeSantis is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he remains President through that time. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Biden continues to be President until the end of July 2024 and (b) Ron DeSantis becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if Biden is still the US President at the close of July 2024 (ET); it will be marked as NO if he steps down, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date. A temporary handover of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES answer. (An Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution)

(b) This inquiry will be answered as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be marked as **No**. This question is not limited to candidates currently recognized; additional candidates may be introduced later. For this question, it does not matter who is awarded the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is determined solely by who the delegates of the Republican National Convention select.

question.title: Will either Joe Biden remain President through the end of July 2024 or Ron DeSantis become the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question resolves YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); this resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution) OR (b) Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the election. All other candidates will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither Joe Biden remain President through the end of July 2024 nor Ron DeSantis become the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body: This question resolves YES if neither of the following occurs: (a) Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); this resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution) nor (b) Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the election. All other candidates will resolve as YES.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Joe Biden to stay in office until the end of July 2024, or for Ron DeSantis to be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) Joe Biden continues to serve as President of the United States until the conclusion of July 2024 (Eastern Time); a NO answer will be given if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date. A temporary shift of authority under the 25th amendment (meaning his Vice President takes over as Acting President) does not result in a YES answer. (The role of Acting President is distinct from that of President according to the Constitution) OR (b) Ron DeSantis is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is made exclusively based on who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is announced as the nominee on the election day. All other candidates will be considered as NO.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be 2 or less, or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump have a lead over Joe Biden that is more than 2 but not exceeding 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the amount by which Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

not_P.title: Will Kamala Harris not be the Democratic VP?
not_P.body: If Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If she is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

para_P.title: Is Kamala Harris set to be the Democratic Vice President?
para_P.body: Should Kamala Harris receive the nomination for the Democratic Vice Presidency, this market will conclude with a yes. Conversely, if another individual is chosen for the VP role, the market will conclude with a no. Any changes to the VP position after the original nomination will not affect the outcome of this market. The resolution of the market can occur right after the nomination.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP nominee?
question.body:
(a) Trump's lead over Biden will be determined by 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, and the value must be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 for this condition to be met.
(b) Kamala Harris must be nominated as the Democratic VP. If she is nominated, this condition is met, regardless of any changes after the initial nomination. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

not_P.title: Will either of the following not occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 4 or less than or equal to 2 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or (b) Kamala Harris not be the Democratic VP nominee?
not_P.body:
(a) Trump's lead over Biden will be determined by 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, and the value must be greater than 4 or less than or equal to 2 for this condition to be met.
(b) Kamala Harris must not be nominated as the Democratic VP. If she is not nominated, this condition is met, regardless of any changes after the initial nomination. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) Trump's margin over Biden exceeds 2 but does not surpass 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Kamala Harris is selected as the Democratic vice-presidential candidate?
para_P.body:
(a) Trump's margin over Biden will be assessed based on 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, which was accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, and this lead must be greater than 2 and not more than 4 for this condition to be satisfied.
(b) Kamala Harris must be chosen as the Democratic vice-presidential candidate. If she is chosen, this condition is fulfilled, regardless of any subsequent changes after her initial selection. The market can resolve right after the selection.

question.title: Will either Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. (b) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to YES. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to NO. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

not_P.title: Will neither Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, nor will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following occurs: (a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. (b) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to YES. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to YES. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump have a lead over Joe Biden that is more than 2 but at most 4 in 538's national polling average, or will Kamala Harris be chosen as the Democratic Vice President?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election that exceeds 2 and is at most 4 on July 15, 2024, as shown on the chart for that date when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. (b) Kamala Harris is selected as the Democratic Vice President. If Kamala Harris is selected for this role, the outcome will be YES. If a different individual is appointed as VP, the outcome will be NO. Changes to the VP after the initial selection will not affect the resolution of this inquiry. The market can resolve right after the nomination.

question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

not_P.title: Will an athlete not win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if no athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a tennis player to secure multiple medals at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
para_P.body: This inquiry concludes with a **Yes** if any tennis player earns a minimum of two medals during the 2024 Paris Olympic Games.

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No". 

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

not_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win <21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win less than 21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No". 

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won less than 21 gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

para_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Achieve 21 or More Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This market will determine a "Yes" outcome if Individual Neutral Athletes as a group secure 21 or more gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The resolution will be based on the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [reputable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) in case the IOC's reporting is not available. If not, the market will conclude with a "No". 

Should it be confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have earned 21 or more gold medals before the conclusion of the Games, the market will instantly resolve to "Yes".

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (1) An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis, and (2) Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (2) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution for the second condition will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. The market for the second condition will resolve immediately to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (1) An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis, nor (2) Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met: (1) No athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (2) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win fewer than 21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution for the second condition will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. The market for the second condition will resolve immediately to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won fewer than 21 gold medals prior to the end of the Games.

para_P.title: Will both of these events take place during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (1) A tennis player secures more than one medal, and (2) Individual Neutral Athletes achieve a total of 21 or more gold medals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) Any tennis player wins at least two medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (2) Individual Neutral Athletes together earn 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The resolution for the second criterion will rely on the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources if the IOC's reporting is not available. The market for the second criterion will resolve instantly to "Yes" if it is confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have won 21 or more gold medals before the conclusion of the Games.

question.title: Will either an athlete win more than one medal for tennis or Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. (b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution for (b) will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, (b) will resolve immediately to "Yes".

not_P.title: Will neither an athlete win more than one medal for tennis nor Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. (b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution for (b) will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, (b) will resolve immediately to "No".

para_P.title: Will any tennis player secure multiple medals or will the Individual Neutral Athletes achieve at least 21 gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if either of the following happens: (a) Any tennis player earns two or more medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics. (b) The Individual Neutral Athletes together obtain 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The determination for (b) will be based on the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources if the IOC's reporting is not available. If it is confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have won 21 or more gold medals before the conclusion of the Games, (b) will be resolved to "Yes" immediately.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden does not appear in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If a qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden engage in a face-to-face interview on camera lasting over 45 minutes, prior to the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview was Biden's participation on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

If Biden takes part in another such face-to-face interview for a minimum of 45 minutes, this market will conclude with a YES. Conversely, if no qualifying interview is made public before the market closes at the end of July, the market will conclude with a NO. 

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, and similar events. It may include appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews edited into programs like 60 Minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in person for such appearances to qualify. A 50-minute video might only showcase 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not meet the criteria.

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous appearances on 60 Minutes have all contained less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but at most 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure denotes a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, AND (2) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(1) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, released before the end of July 2024. Qualifying interviews include appearances on podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 Minutes, with at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed. Press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, and town halls do not count. 

(2) According to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, Trump's lead over Biden must be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points. A positive value indicates a Trump lead. The value will be checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, NOR (2) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
(1) Joe Biden must not appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, released before the end of July 2024. Qualifying interviews include appearances on podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 Minutes, with at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed. Press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, and town halls do not count. 

(2) According to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, Trump's lead over Biden must not be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points. A positive value indicates a Trump lead. The value will be checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will happen: (1) Joe Biden participates in a face-to-face interview for over 45 minutes before July 2024 concludes, AND (2) on July 15, 2024, Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 3 but not exceeding 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(1) Joe Biden is required to engage in a face-to-face interview lasting a minimum of 45 minutes, to be released prior to the conclusion of July 2024. Eligible interviews include those on podcasts, late-night television programs, or similar shows like 60 Minutes, containing at least 45 minutes of fresh footage featuring Biden being interviewed. Events such as press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, and town halls are excluded. 

(2) Based on 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as indicated on the chart dated July 15, 2024, Trump's lead over Biden must be greater than 3 and at most 4 points. A positive figure signifies a lead for Trump. This value will be verified by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Joe Biden have an in-person interview for 45+ minutes, or (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) Joe Biden has an in-person interview/conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. The interview must be in-person and feature at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed. Qualifying appearances include podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 minutes, but not press conferences, speeches, rallies, etc. 

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Joe Biden have an in-person interview for 45+ minutes, nor (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
(a) Joe Biden does not have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. The interview must be in-person and feature at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed. Qualifying appearances include podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 minutes, but not press conferences, speeches, rallies, etc. 

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is not greater than 3 and not less than or equal to 4 points according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed on July 17, 2024. A positive value does not indicate a Trump lead.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will one of the following happen: (a) Joe Biden participate in an in-person interview lasting over 45 minutes, or (b) will Donald Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 3 and at most 4 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(a) Joe Biden engages in an in-person interview or discussion recorded on camera for no less than 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024. This interview must be conducted face-to-face and include a minimum of 45 minutes of fresh footage of Biden being interviewed. Acceptable formats include podcasts, late-night talk shows, or programs like 60 Minutes, but exclude press conferences, speeches, rallies, etc. 

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump is leading Joe Biden by more than 3 points and at most 4 points according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as shown on the chart for that date when checked on July 17, 2024. A positive number signifies a lead for Trump.

question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who holds the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is elected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.body:

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are met by market close, this market resolves NO.

Even multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' endorsements would be adequate to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value showed Trump ahead by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 4 or less than or equal to 2 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Joe Biden not be president by the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is not officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden exceeds 2 but is at most 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average? (b) Joe Biden remains the president until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will conclude based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as per 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump advantage, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

(b) This market will affirm yes if, at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024, Joe Biden is still recognized as the president of the United States.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.
