This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to publicly oppose their party's attempt to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination earlier than planned, which they contend hampers the vigorous ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, as per a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter drafted by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO serves as the initial public indication from Democrats following the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump, revealing that many of their members are still profoundly concerned about the trajectory of Biden’s candidacy.

Huffman remarked in an interview, “It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Someone thinks it’s a clever way to stifle debate and, by sheer force, achieve unity, but that’s not how it works.” He refrained from confirming the letter's existence.

This market will resolve to YES if a public statement opposing the early nomination initiative is endorsed by at least 20 House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if there are multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures, that would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is a brokered convention expected for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if only a single ballot is necessary, then the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥15 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No".

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

not_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win <15 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:

Otherwise the market will resolve to "No".

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won fewer than 15 gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

para_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Achieve at Least 15 Gold Medals in the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes together secure 15 or more gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The resolution will be based on the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources if the IOC's reporting is not available. If not, the market will conclude with a "No".

Should it be confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have won 15 or more gold medals before the Games conclude, the market will immediately resolve to "Yes".

question.title: Will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) receive a CinemaScore of B or above?
question.body:
This market resolves YES if "Trap" (2024) receives a B CinemaScore or higher, and it resolves NO if it receives a B- or lower. If for some reason a CinemaScore is not reported, this resolves N/A.

Context: 

"Trap" is the next film directed by the legendary M. Night Shyamalan (with a great trailer).

Here are the CinemaScores for some of his recent films:

"Split" - B+

"Glass" - B

"Old" - C+

"Knock at the Cabin" - C

You can search the CinemaScore website for more examples.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) "House of the Dragon" S2E8 (season finale) be rated >8.5 on IMDB, 2 days after release, and (b) M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) receive a CinemaScore of B or above?
question.body:
(a) "House of the Dragon" S2E8 (title TBA) will be rated above 8.5 on IMDB, based on the score displayed two days after release (August 6th), at noon PT. The rating will use the precision listed by IMDB (typically a single decimal), and this is a strict inequality. Current IMDB ratings for HotD Season 1 episodes range from 8.0 to 9.3, and Season 2 episodes range from 6.1 to 9.6.

(b) "Trap" (2024), directed by M. Night Shyamalan, will receive a CinemaScore of B or higher. It resolves YES if it receives a B CinemaScore or higher, and resolves NO if it receives a B- or lower. If a CinemaScore is not reported, this resolves N/A. Recent CinemaScores for Shyamalan's films include: "Split" - B+, "Glass" - B, "Old" - C+, "Knock at the Cabin" - C.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) "House of the Dragon" S2E8 (season finale) be rated >8.5 on IMDB, 2 days after release, nor (b) M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) receive a CinemaScore of B or above?
not_P.body:
(a) "House of the Dragon" S2E8 (title TBA) will not be rated above 8.5 on IMDB, based on the score displayed two days after release (August 6th), at noon PT. The rating will use the precision listed by IMDB (typically a single decimal), and this is a strict inequality. Current IMDB ratings for HotD Season 1 episodes range from 8.0 to 9.3, and Season 2 episodes range from 6.1 to 9.6.

(b) "Trap" (2024), directed by M. Night Shyamalan, will not receive a CinemaScore of B or higher. It resolves YES if it receives a B- CinemaScore or lower, and resolves NO if it receives a B CinemaScore or higher. If a CinemaScore is not reported, this resolves N/A. Recent CinemaScores for Shyamalan's films include: "Split" - B+, "Glass" - B, "Old" - C+, "Knock at the Cabin" - C.

para_P.body:
(a) The season finale of "House of the Dragon" S2E8 (title to be announced) will achieve an IMDB rating greater than 8.5, as indicated by the score shown two days after its release (August 6th), at noon PT. The rating will follow the precision provided by IMDB (usually a single decimal), and this is a strict inequality. Current IMDB ratings for episodes of HotD Season 1 range from 8.0 to 9.3, while Season 2 episodes vary from 6.1 to 9.6.

(b) The film "Trap" (2024), directed by M. Night Shyamalan, will earn a CinemaScore of B or higher. It will be considered YES if it gets a CinemaScore of B or above, and NO if it scores B- or below. If no CinemaScore is reported, this will be marked as N/A. Recent CinemaScores for Shyamalan's movies include: "Split" - B+, "Glass" - B, "Old" - C+, "Knock at the Cabin" - C.

question.title: Will either "House of the Dragon" S2E8 be rated >8.5 on IMDB, 2 days after release, or will "Trap" (2024) receive a CinemaScore of B or above?
question.body:
Resolution:

This question resolves to YES if at least one of the following occurs:

(a) "House of the Dragon" S2E8 (title TBA) receives an IMDB rating greater than 8.5 two days after its release (August 6th), at noon PT. The rating used will be the one displayed on IMDB at that time with a precision of one decimal place, and the inequality is strict. The market closes 90 minutes after the episode premieres. Current IMDB ratings for "House of the Dragon" are available for context.

(b) M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) receives a CinemaScore of B or higher. If "Trap" receives a B CinemaScore or higher, this part resolves YES; if it receives a B- or lower, this part resolves NO. If a CinemaScore is not reported, this part resolves N/A. Context includes CinemaScores for Shyamalan's recent films such as "Split" (B+), "Glass" (B), "Old" (C+), and "Knock at the Cabin" (C).

not_P.body:
Resolution:

(b) M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) receives a CinemaScore of B or higher. If "Trap" receives a B CinemaScore or higher, this part resolves NO; if it receives a B- or lower, this part resolves YES. If a CinemaScore is not reported, this part resolves N/A. Context includes CinemaScores for Shyamalan's recent films such as "Split" (B+), "Glass" (B), "Old" (C+), and "Knock at the Cabin" (C).

question.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Liz Cheney not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Liz Cheney is selected as the nominee, this question will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Liz Cheney going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden make a declaration before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for the position of President?

A Yes resolution will occur if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and public announcement indicating that he will not pursue or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a Yes resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for the presidency in the 2024 election cycle.

question.title: Will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

This question will resolve as Yes if the ID political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as No for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, at least one sub-question will resolve as No. This question resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) The French Prime Minister is part of a coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together on July 30, 2024, and (b) The ID political faction secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
(a) The French Prime Minister is part of a coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together on July 30, 2024. This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the Prime Minister's party is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to reliable sources.

(b) The ID political faction secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections. This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the ID political faction holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will be marked as negative for all other political factions. If two factions are tied for seats, both sub-questions will be marked affirmative. This inquiry resolves based on official declarations from the European Parliament or trustworthy media reports.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024 (b) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following conditions are met: (a) The party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. (b) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as No for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as Yes. This question resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) The Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024 (b) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if neither of the following conditions are met: (a) The party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. (b) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as No for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as No. This question resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Is it possible that: (a) The French Prime Minister is affiliated with a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024 (b) The ID political faction secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmed if at least one of the following situations occurs: (a) The coalition of the French Prime Minister is neither New Popular Front nor Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, as reported by reliable sources. (b) The ID political faction achieves the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will be deemed negative for all other political factions. In the event of a tie between two factions for seats, both sub-questions will be regarded as affirmed. This question will be resolved based on official announcements from the European Parliament or trustworthy media coverage.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Ted Cruz going to be the chosen candidate for the Republican Party in the 2024 Presidential Election in the United States?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as their candidate for the 2024 Presidential Election in the United States. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional candidates may be included later.

For the purpose of this question, it doesn't matter who secures the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is solely based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in favor of Trump over Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3 based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as depicted in the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump advantage, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, nor (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Ted Cruz becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Trump's advantage over Biden will be more than 2 but at most 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Ted Cruz is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be answered with **No**. This question is open to the possibility of other candidates being included in the future.

The determination of this question does not hinge on who is nominated by the Republicans on the day of the 2024 US election; it strictly relies on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) This question will conclude that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) will be reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicated Trump was 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will either Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Trump's lead over Biden be between 2 and 3 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/). This is as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

not_P.title: Will neither Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election nor Trump's lead over Biden be between 2 and 3 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/). This is as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either Ted Cruz will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or that Trump's advantage over Biden will fall between 2 and 3 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not by who is named the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden is more than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/). This is as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates a Biden lead.

question.title: Will Switzerland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Switzerland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Switzerland not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Switzerland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Switzerland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Switzerland going to be in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Switzerland competes in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Switzerland fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will Portugal qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Portugal does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Portugal not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Portugal does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Portugal qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Portugal going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Portugal takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Portugal fails to qualify, the inquiry will conclude as **No**.

question.title: Will both Switzerland and Portugal qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Switzerland and Portugal participate in a Semi-final and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Switzerland nor Portugal qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither Switzerland nor Portugal participate in a Semi-final or are not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both do qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Switzerland and Portugal set to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Switzerland and Portugal take part in a Semi-final and are officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured their spots in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If one or both fail to qualify, the outcome will be a **No**.

question.title: Will either Switzerland or Portugal qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Switzerland nor Portugal qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Switzerland nor Portugal qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Switzerland or Portugal qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Switzerland or Portugal set to reach the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if one of the following takes place: (a) Switzerland competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Portugal competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Switzerland nor Portugal advances, the inquiry will be regarded as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of these events will take place: (a) Kalenjin runners claim victory in both the men's and women's marathon events at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (b) Sifan Hassan secures a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry is answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) The champions of the men's and women's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin heritage, based on reliable sources. (b) Sifan Hassan achieves any medal position at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It is answered with **No** in all other cases.

question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either (a) both the winner of the men's and women's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions), or (b) Sifan Hassan wins any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics. not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if neither (a) both the winner of the men's and women's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions), nor (b) Sifan Hassan wins any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is it possible for one of the following to happen at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) Kalenjin runners take first place in both the men's and women's marathon events (b) Sifan Hassan secures a medal?

It will be marked NO in all other cases.

question.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
question.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote in favor of Elon Musk's $57 billion package AND the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
not_P.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) does not release a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting AND the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: [Short Fuse] Will Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) recommend that Tesla investors oppose Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation package or Kimbal Musk's re-election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a statement clearly recommending that Tesla investors vote *against* Elon Musk's compensation plan at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting or the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the board of directors. If not, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will BOTH of the following occur: (1) Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advises Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk AND (2) Donald Trump Jr. is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if BOTH of the following conditions are met: (1) Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* either Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors, AND (2) Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. not_P.title: Will NEITHER of the following occur: (1) Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advises Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package AND the re-election of Kimbal Musk NOR (2) Donald Trump Jr. is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
