Resolver

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if no public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic members from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the proposal to nominate Biden prematurely?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s initiative to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination earlier than initially scheduled, arguing that this suppresses the vital ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, as stated by a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their members are significantly concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to shut down debate and I suppose through sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t function that way,” Huffman remarked in an interview. He refrained from confirming the existence of a letter.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination strategy is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who are part of the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not satisfied by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be president by Friday and will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a letter opposing the early nomination plan?
question.body: This question resolves to YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting, AND (b) a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before the end of Sunday, July 21st, as reported by credible sources, including the possibility of multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures. If either condition is not met, this question resolves to NO.

not_P.title: Will Kamala Harris not be president by Friday or will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a letter opposing the early nomination plan?
not_P.body: This question resolves to YES if either of the following conditions is met: (a) Vice President Kamala Harris is not formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting, OR (b) a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before the end of Sunday, July 21st, as reported by credible sources, including the possibility of multiple letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 signatures. If both conditions are met, this question resolves to NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Kamala Harris to assume the presidency by Friday, and will a minimum of 20 Democratic members of the House or Senate endorse a letter against the early nomination proposal?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, according to official communications from the US government or a collective agreement of reliable news sources, AND (b) a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is endorsed by at least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators before the conclusion of Sunday, July 21st, as confirmed by trustworthy reports, which may include several letters that together have a total of 20 signatures. If either of these criteria is not fulfilled, the answer to this question will be NO.

question.title: Will either Kamala Harris be president by Friday or will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
This question combines two separate forecasting questions:

(a) Kamala Harris as President by Friday: This resolves to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source will be official information from the US government, with a consensus of credible reporting also considered.

(b) Opposition to Biden's Early Nomination Plan: This resolves to "Yes" if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures are sufficient.

This combined question resolves to "Yes" if either (a) Kamala Harris is designated as President or Acting President by the specified time, or (b) at least 20 Democratic lawmakers sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan by the specified deadline.

not_P.title: Will neither Kamala Harris be president by Friday nor will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body:
This question combines two separate forecasting questions:

(a) Kamala Harris as President by Friday: This resolves to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source will be official information from the US government, with a consensus of credible reporting also considered.

(b) Opposition to Biden's Early Nomination Plan: This resolves to "Yes" if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures are sufficient.

This combined question resolves to "Yes" if neither (a) Kamala Harris is designated as President or Acting President by the specified time, nor (b) at least 20 Democratic lawmakers sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan by the specified deadline.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that Kamala Harris will assume the presidency by Friday, or that a minimum of 20 Democratic members of the House or Senate will endorse a public letter against the proposal to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body:
This inquiry merges two distinct forecasting questions:

(a) Kamala Harris becoming President by Friday: This will be considered "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The main source for resolution will be official announcements from the US government, along with a consensus from reliable reporting.

(b) Disapproval of Biden's Early Nomination Proposal: This will be deemed "Yes" if a public letter opposing the early nomination proposal is signed by no fewer than 20 House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes on Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters with a total of 20 signatures are acceptable.

This combined query will resolve to "Yes" if either (a) Kamala Harris is recognized as President or Acting President by the given deadline, or (b) at least 20 Democratic legislators sign a public letter opposing the early nomination proposal by the specified time.

question.title: Will Georgia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Georgia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Georgia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Georgia set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Georgia takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other result, the inquiry will be deemed **No**.

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Malta not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Malta set to advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Malta competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if they do not advance, the inquiry will conclude with a **No**.

question.title: Will both Georgia and Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Malta participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will either Georgia or Malta not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following occurs: (a) Georgia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Malta does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are both Georgia and Malta set to advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Georgia takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In any other scenario, the inquiry will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either Georgia or Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Malta participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Georgia nor Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Malta participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Georgia or Malta make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Georgia competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Malta competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither advances, the inquiry will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Will Hurd not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

If Biden engages in another such face-to-face interview for a minimum of 45 minutes, this market will resolve to YES. Conversely, if no qualifying interview is made available before the market closes at the end of July, this market will resolve to NO.

However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to be considered valid. A 50-minute video might only showcase 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not qualify.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The lack of removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on the stipulations of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reputable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may take place after the specified date. It solely focuses on whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the mentioned grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or prevented from any ballot as of July 15, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden has an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024 (b) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, as long as there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

(b) Donald Trump must be officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The removal or block is strictly considered as of July 15, 2024, and does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after this date.

This must not be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The removal or block is strictly considered as of July 15, 2024, and does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after this date.

(b) Donald Trump must be officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

If neither of these scenarios occurs, the question will resolve as "No."

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump faces Joe Biden rather than a standard Democrat, will he achieve at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two Manifold polls are available, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to cast their vote alongside Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other inquires about voting with a standard Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion surveys regularly indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump by a margin greater than the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat hypothetically assessed either leads or remains within the margin of error. Are Manifold participants reflective of the broader public?

This market will conclude with a YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more upon the closing of both polls.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

The polls and this question will not resolve as N/A and will remain active until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

(b) Kamala Harris does not pick either Kelly or Shapiro as her VP: The two favorites for Kamala’s running mate are currently Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. Kamala will choose before August 7th. This resolves YES if Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate as someone other than Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro. This resolves NO if Kamala Harris announces either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro as her running mate. The pick must be confirmed by Kamala herself for resolution.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Trump receives a minimum of 3% more support from Manifold respondents when compared to Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, or (b) Kamala Harris selects either Kelly or Shapiro as her Vice President?
para_P.body:
(a) Trump receives a minimum of 3% more support from Manifold respondents when compared to Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat: There are two Manifold polls that close on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and the other asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat. This will be confirmed as YES if Trump’s vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more when the polls close. The percentage of votes for Trump is calculated using the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the result is NO.

(b) Kamala Harris selects either Kelly or Shapiro as her Vice President: The two leading candidates for Kamala’s running mate at present are Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. Kamala will make her choice before August 7th. This resolves to YES if Kamala Harris declares her running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro. It resolves to NO if she announces anyone else as her running mate. The choice must be confirmed by Kamala herself for resolution.

question.title: Will Georgia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

para_P.title: Are both Georgia and Lithuania going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
